I called back the same day an inform them on what was in her box an ill be back the next day. I couldn't make it that Sunday but we came the following Tuesday,get there they do,y have the match to either shoe. So mow we don't yo ordering shoes now this where the rude employee comes in she already stated that this wasn't her day well she was rude talk to the manager about it. So the shoes her ordered call back Friday just to check on the order she couldn't find her order so she put me on hold (the manager) I was on hold for 30mins before I hung up tried calling back but it was busy guess she forgot I was on hold going to call again today.

This store also has great selection and a very well priced clearance section. I had heard horror stories of people getting wrong sized shoes in stores like this since there's only one shoe in the box. But never been a problem for me here!

resp.text:
Thank you Todd.  We appreciate you putting your trust in us.  Hope to see you in the shop again soon.
-Aaron-

name: Charles Montgomery
text: They moved next door, but still a great business for our sport.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review Charles!  We indeed did move next door in order to accommodate for a remodel and utilize a square footage that fits our needs just right! We hope you enjoyed the updates and thank you for shopping local with us!

name: Brandon Rouse
text: Very friendly and knowledgable staff and locally owned that gives back to the local community

resp.text: Thank you Brandon.  We appreciate your patronage and leadership in the community as well.

name: Sara Nicoles
text: Probably a great running store, however the young girl who assisted me will ensure I never return again. She laughed and smirked at my small feet and then did not provide guidance around the store. Instead she she smirked some more and said "umm over here". Zero customer service or even common curtesy. I was immediately turned off after she laughed at my small stature. Go, but insist on another employee.

resp.text:
Sara-

I am sorry to hear of your poor experience I would love to hear more about this visit and work to rectify the situation as I assure you this is not what we are about at Run N Tri.  You may call and speak to me personally at 251-340-8101 or email me at runntrimobile@gmail.com   I apologize for the delay in this response as I have just activated the ability to respond on Google today after your review was brought to my attention.  As a small local business I take it very personal when situations like this arise. I hope to hear from you soon.

Aaron Freesmeier

name: Troy Whatley
text: Aaron and his staff have always been super helpful!!

resp.text: Thank you Troy!  Let us know when you are coming back through town.  Maybe you can make a guest appearance at the Dolla this summer?!!!

resp.text: We miss you Devin! Holla Holla!

name: sydney hatch
text:
I purchased about $1,000 worth of shoes from Heart And Sole. I had them shipped to my house. Jordan 4 PSGs were supposed to be a size 7M. I specifically DM the official instagram page of Heart and Sole and they told me it was not a gradeschool size, but a men size. When they arrived they turned out to be a size 7Y. Cactus Jack 270 Reacts size 10.5 were sold as deadstock on the website. When they came in, they had dirt on both of the bottoms of the shoes and no tag. They said they couldn’t do anything for me about the jordan 4 PSGs, even though they had lied to me when I asked if it was in men’s or gradeschool. Gradeschool shoes are cheaper than mens shoes, so when they said they were in men’s sizing, it’s completely different than gradeschool prices. They didn’t seem at all bothered by my awful experience shopping with them. Will never buy anything from them again. They have shown to not care about customer service at all. Haven’t heart back about the Cactus Jack Reacts yet.
Also, the $18 shipping ended up being awful. There was no bubble wrap, paper, or anything protective around any of the boxes. When the boxes arrived, the tape wasn’t even sealed on the box.

resp.text: Stop it Sydney. You purchased during our Black Friday Sale which was 40% off with the intentions on reselling the shoes for your profit. It’s not our fault that a size 7 men is reselling higher than a size 7 grade school. You purchased several shoes and we only charged $18 to ship the entire order. You have to stop whining at some point. You whined because you couldn’t see that the order shipped due to USPS tracking not updating their tracking status. Even though we did ship out the next day for you. Now it’s 30 plus days later and you whining again. Looks like you want attention. I didn’t reference the Cactus Jack 270 because that’s a new complaint you just now bringing up over 30 plus days later. But to appease you we don’t sell shoes with dirty bottoms. Let me take a wild guess you copped an amazing Black Friday Deal (40% off) from us and wanted to back door resell the shoes at the reselling market price and you still stuck with the shoes... DEFINITELY NOT OUR PROBLEM! You Sydney deserve a 1 Star Rating as a Reseller!!! -Shaun (Owner)

name: Joy Claborn
text: This sneaker boutique is definitely in a class of its own here in Huntsville!!! The down to earth owners/employees makes a superb customer service!!! They are adamant in assisting you to get what your looking for!!  The eclectic scenery completes the dope atmosphere!! This place is exclusive and I recommend it to any and everyone!!

name: Jalesa Fletcher
text: Jordan released their “Flight Nostalgia” Jordan 9 back in March and I was unable to purchase a pair in a youth size before they sold out. Fast forward 4 months later, I found them in stock at Heart & Sole! This store has an excellent selection and is the perfect place to come for limited releases and exclusives that you can’t find anywhere else. The staff was friendly, the store was clean, and the prices were great!  I would definitely recommend Heart & Sole as a great place to shop for sneakers!

name: Tarus Godbolt
text: You won't find another sneaker shopping experience like it anywhere in Huntsville.  The staff is super knowledgeable and friendly.  They have exclusive shoes that you can't get anywhere else.  They have a stellar social media presence so you always know what they have in stock and whats going on in the store.  Can't wait to visit again.  Like I said, an experience like no other!!!

name: Taylor Leonard
text: The store has a very cool, laid back vibe and the merchandise is legit and fly! Great customer service! The staff is very attentive and accommodating. I brought them a pair of shoes that I bought for a special occasion and that I would never wear again. I was able to go through the consignment process and get my shoes listed and sold. Very smooth process! I would recommend doing business with them any day.

name: Chris Edmondson
text: Great selection of shoes

name: Courtney Prevost
text: I had a pair of shoes that I bought somewhere else, that ended up being too big for me. The staff at Heart and Sole were able to list the shoes for me and get them sold. I had never sold shoes before so I was totally oblivious to the process, but the guy that helped me thoroughly explained the process, and made it very easy for me to sale the shoes. I would definitely do business with them again!

name: Cash Freeman
text: I recently visited Heart & Soul doing some back to school shopping for my son. The boutique was super nice. The staff was attentive, friendly & knowledgeable. If there’s an item that you want and they don’t have it in store they can get it for you!!!

name: Jeremy Marc Anthony
text: For someone like me who has decided to put down the Westwood’s, Hann’s and McQueen’s of the world to step into a new genre of footwear, there was only one place to go, Heart & Sole. The customer service was amazing, Co-Owner Pastor Adrian Davis became Stylist Adrian Davis, selecting shoes geared towards my style and personality. He was focused and very attentive. The inventory was not limited to what was in the store, if there is something you want in a different color or style, the staff can get it in for you. I was extremely pleased with my visit and will be going back again.

name: Mark Hutchison
text:
My wife surprised me by taking me to the store for my birthday.

What a great selection of shirts and other clothing.

Charles and his staff did an excellent job.

A must Vis when traveling though Tuscaloosa.

Thanks again

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your kind review! We hope to see you soon!

name: Shelby Lamkin
text: HORRIBLE!! The owner is SO RUDE! Follows you around the store like you are stealing, stares at you the entire time, and makes you feel like you aren’t good enough to even be in there. I’ve been there 3 times and always had the same feeling. The owner even insulted one of my family members for the way he was dressed! I refuse to go there ever again or spend any money in there, and I will be sure to spread the word on how they run their business!

resp.text: We are sorry we made you feel uncomfortable. This was not our intention. We try to be attentive  to and create conversation with every customer.  We would love to talk to you about your experience - (205) 752-6931.

name: J Parker Rhodes
text: Never shopping here again.  One of my sales reps reached out to see if they would be interested in us sending them a holiday sample box. She was treated absolutely terrible.  There exact words were: "It's the holidays, if your line was good enough to be in our store it would be by now".   That's the kind of attitude that gets you left in the dust.

name: Ryan Grant
text: Got a hat from here, there was a small issue with it and the helpful staff sent me a replacement very promptly. Great customer service.

name: James Cain
text:
The best of the best!  A Tuscsaloosa tradition for over 40 years.  Suits and sports coats expertly fitted with service and expertise that you simply can’t find anymore.  Quality is the best you can find.  I am still wearing suits that I bought there 15 years ago!   The owner has an eye for the next big thing in fashion. And he brings it to Tuscaloosa before you can find it anywhere else.
Your new shirt will be steamed while you wait so it’s ready to wear for that big occasion.  Your pants and jacket will be fitted and altered to give you that custom made look.
If you want the best service and best selection, go to The Shirt Shop, a Tuscaloosa icon.

name: Sabrina Steuber
text: I have only visited your store once when I visited Tuscaloosa and my experience was a positive one, I truly love all the game day shirts! I am an online shopper and always end up purchasing your Comfort Colors elephant shirts/tank tops. Shipping is very fast and great quality as usual! Love this store. Roll Tide!

name: Cristine Kuo
text: I absolutely love this store! I usually order online since I live in Tennessee, but whenever I order their merchandise it ships promptly and the customer service is great. I absolutely LOVE their rival t-shirts. It’s my favorite and I have been ordering all of them for the past several years! Thanks again for making these great shirts!

name: Logan Newsome
text: Shopped here on the Saturday before Christmas and although I don’t usually leave reviews I was impressed with this stores service and quality of their products. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding just the right items for my needs. You will never find this level of service, nor the quality in the big box stores. Thank you Shirt Shop for assisting me in purchasing the best Christmas gifts! I will definitely return.

name: Jeremy Hudson
text: The staff here is what makes this place the best. I’ve never met people who were so into providing the best customer service experience around. I got a size too large in a jacket once and I had to exchange it. Not only did Bethany go find jackets in my size but elected not to charge me the difference in price. I always get the help and knowledge of the products in store to assure I’ve got the right size in my hand at checkout! Not only that, but they are quick to respond to my Instagram messages, and send me products!

name: Tanner Corley
text: they have great staff. helpful in every way possible. very friendly also. if you’re in tuscaloosa stop by and check them out

name: Ashlyn Pounders
text: I love the Shirt Shop! Great products and even better customer service! Highly recommend :)

name: Alan Ruth
text: A great store and Charles will definitely take care of you. Visiting from CO and they were very accommodating as we arrived right before closing. They helped my daughter find what she had been looking for. Thank you! Great service!!!

name: Kyle Jernigan
text: See. Leck. Shun.  Selection.  And service.  That's the 2 things I always find at this place. Yes, there is a ton of inventory but that's because they have 100 different options from which to choose - just when picking out a button up shirt. It's the same for slacks or a suit, they have every option you can imagine or have seen online. They don't have " just blue and white" button downs, they have every possible style/color/pattern which is awesome. It's almost hard to make a decision but they help you narrow it down to what you really like. They greet you when you walk in and help you find what you want and they don't show you something you may not like. And then they make sure it fits. Imagine having someone show you around, help you find just what you like, and then making sure it fits you just right. It's one of the finer things you can enjoy.

name: Stacey Lynch
text: This place would be decent if there wasn’t so much stuff shoved in one tiny place.

name: Trey Bagnardi
text: This place was not worth my time. I thought it would be super helpful and I would be able to find what I wanted, but I could not find anything. The shirts also smell really bad.

name: Scott Ward
text: They treated me with respect and were very helpful in finding an item that was right for me not just a sale

name: Wendy Sherrod
text: Wanted to buy something for Christmas, but the website was just too complicated. I recommend moving to a new website builder.

name: Liz Dickenson

I won't be visiting again, and I do not like to feel like I'm being watched when I'm shopping and I'm genuinely just looking around.

text: 5 out of 5. Not too much experience with this place, but the few times I have been it has been good. I purchased a high dollar pair of sunglasses from here.  I ended up having an allergic reaction to the nose pads.  I took them back to the store a week later and they had no problem exchanging them for another pair.  Service is always friendly with somebody always asking if you need help when walking in (but not in a pushy kind of way).

text: I have shopped here for many years. Now that I live out of town I still make special trips to come back and shop at the Shirt Shop!!!

name: Wendy Smith
text: Customer service was excellent , even with a store full of shoppers.  Great selection and quality.

name: S. B.
text: I went to this store over many years after graduating from Alabama buying $1000's worth of merchandise in the past.  This past year I picked a Peter Millar Windbreaker that Charles Spurlin the owner personally said he would get monogrammed for me, I paid for the windbreaker and the monogram and left expecting to pick up in a week.  I live out of town and made a special trip back to pick up the next week.  On arrival Charles notified me that the logo was printed upside down (duh!) and that he would get another one and have it done with either the retro Alabama logo or get a new windbreaker.  I returned for the third time and he told me it wasn't done and that he would refund my purchase price.  Well Charles you cost me three private trips to your store, endless aggravation of incompetence and not receiving the windbreaker that I chose and paid for.   My time is valuable so we are not "square".  What is even worse, I gave you my number and you said you would call me to let me know what could be done.  Needless to say, I heard nothing.

name: Ted Turner
text: Best shirts in T-Town..Charles, the owner is a great man to know.. he will treat you right.

name: Jin Zhao
text: Bought some Roll Tide caps. Nice place.

name: Carly Mullady Cowan
text:
I've ordered online several times and was very excited to bring my upcoming freshman brother to the shop, which carries many items we *would* have been interested in purchasing. I almost purchased groomsman shirts from them last fall and am so relieved I didn't. I will not so much as order online ever again. I'm in my 30s and was well dressed aside from a necessary Columbia rain jacket and was joined by my mother and younger brother. When you walk in, it feels like an episode of Hoarders. Everything is everywhere. Stacks. Piles. Overstuffed racks. No sense of organization. It feels like an overstocked Goodwill with name brand stickers strewn about. Prices may or may not be on items. Seeing how poorly $80+ shirts are kept in the store is a definite turnoff.
Even less settling however, was being followed by the staff as if I was going to stuff their items in my small Kate Spade crossbody bag. Should the three of us separate in the tiny shop, there'd be a person on each of us at the snap of a finger--and this is after I found a staff member's cell phone in a pile of clothes and turned it in to them. As we perused, I heard them complaining "OH. THAT is why they're here. Orientation."
That's when I rounded up the crew and we visited different stores with organization, fantastic selections, and genuinely kind staff.
Save yourself frustration, a headache, and money. Skip this stop.

So she called Rainbow, and politely explained the situation to them, and she still had a reciept. Rainbow told her that she could not return the item without no tag, they said "On the tag, there is a 7 day return policy". So my question is, why does a simple tag keep a customer from returning a item that is not in good use even though they have a reciept.

text: Buyer beware.  Don’t order from this company!  Ordered a pair of shoes and never received them.  I emailed them 3 times with no response. Also I called the store twice and left messages with no return calls.  I’ve had to open a dispute with PayPal to try to get my money back.  I’ve researched today to find similar reviews about the same problem.

name: Yoen Lopez
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!
They post itemized clothing and shoes for sale on online posts on FB. People will comment and they do not honor the sell/sale.
I commented claiming items with my paypal as a live sale was going on. I never got confirmation. I commented asking what happened with no response. Finally, I pm’d and they asked me to provide dates and pics. I did. They told me that they sold what I had claimed in the store. They no longer had these items available. I asked about another pair of shoes they had posted, and the person told me that the shoes were now full price!  (PS. Their original posts on the “Huge Sale” were all deleted. Thank God for screenshots!)
I searched online and saw that this is a regular occurrence with this business based on customer reviews.
It’s unfortunate because they have precious inventory. BUT it’s irrelevant since they lack ethics and customer service. They do not honor their sale prices or online customers.

name: Katie Salsi
text: Learn from my mistake and avoid this store at all cost! I ordered three pairs of shoes and to date after a three month process of emails with Allen who I guess is the owner I've only received two.I initially order three pairs of shoes I promptly received one pair a few days after my order was placed to my Surprise as I hadn't received an email notification that my order had shipped. I reached out after a week via email and asked when the other two pairs would arrive. I received an email informing me the other two pairs of shoes were out of stock! They provided alternate options that looked similar so I said great please send them. A few days later one pair of shoes arrived still waiting on the third pair and I've reached out via email. Buyer beware!

name: Abi King
text: To start off, the instore experience I had was absolutely wonderful. But this companies faults are in their customer service. I called to complain because I was trying to exchange a tshirt. This should be simple right? WRONG. I had the shirt sent back to me telling me it had be worn, washed, and the tag was cut off. In fact the shirt had NOT been worn, NOT been washed,  & the tag was STILL ON IT (ALL IN PERFECT CONDITION). They strung me along on the call and putting me on hold about 10 time over the HOUR LONG CALL ALL TO TELL ME AT THE END THAT THE SHIRT IS MESSED UP AND CANT BE EXCHANGED. NOW I KNOW THEY WERE JUST TRYING TO KEEP MY MONEY AND NOT HELP ME OUT IN ANY MANNER. I WILL NEVER BUT FROM THIS STORE OR ANY OF THEIR OTHER BRANDS LIKE FOOTLOCKER AND CHAMP EVER AGAIN. AND I PLAN ON LETTING EVERY SINGLE PERSON ON THE INTERNET AWARE OF THIS ABSOLUTE BS.

text: I love shopping at Elitaire. The entire team is knowledgeable and can help you find the best items or looks for your specific style or event. Affordable and high quality, you can tell that Kayla hand picks every single item with her clientele in mind. This is also a great spot for affordable and thoughful jewelry that lasts & other great gifts. Wonderful local products from makers in Huntsville. Also, great atmosphere to shop in. Not pushy or overwhelming - comfortable and open environment to have fun and dress up! Cannot recommend enough. Walkable to coffee shop, downtown restaurants and more. Support this place!

resp.text: We can not thank you enough for this amazing review, Emily! Thank you so much for all the kind words!

Come shop with her soon!!! You will not be disappointed!!!

name: Baylee Fuqua
text: I normally always pick dress up to shop in its close to my house and it’s somewhere me and my daughter both love. We have always had a wonderful experience but today not so much. Today my daughter and her friend decided we’d do some shopping and eating while they had their “big girl” lunch together I walked two stores down to dress up and decided I’d look for her a cute dress while they had their time together to chat! Found the cutest two dresses and proceeded to the check to ask if I could leave them there for ten mins while I walk literally two stores down. I’ve done this time and time before we always eat at the local restaurant connected to the strip mall. I was quickly told NO sorry we can’t hold anything. I was a little shocked and explained she was two doors down and I wanted to make sure they were a good fit due to them being final sale. The two looked at each other and said sorry because you can go online 24 hours and order we aren’t allowed to hold anything. Now if I’d previously not held something before maybe I’d believe them. One proceeded to say I’ll put it in the fitting room and we can just say she’s waiting on the fitting room!! Which means YOUR HOLDING IT. I smiled and told them that was ok and walked out needless to say I will only order from online or if I see the manager ( can’t remeber her name but she’s awesome) I’ll only shop then. These two youngsters possible need a lesson on customer service!!!

text: Unfortunately I can not choose ZERO Stars...I am extremely disappointed in Hibbett Sports. I am a Case Worker at a Homeless Shelter for men and was attempting to make a purchase for one of my clients who had recently received a gift card. This gift card is not associated with a bank, nor individual, yet somehow the Customer Service agent I spoke with determined that the purchase of a pair of shoes and socks was intended for resale and I would not be able to place the purchase. HibbettHurtsHomeless.

text: Wish I could give 0 stars never received my shoes was given a gift card that doesn’t work it’s been two weeks and they are telling me it’s nothing they could do no refunds on gift cards and they don’t know when the website will be accepting gift cards they suck!!!!!!!

text: Employees charge extra for Jordan’s when they are released if you don’t know a employee who work at one of the stores you will not get a pair and I think that’s awful........ even the drawing is rigged

name: Brandon Wallace
text: Shoes went on sale 8 days after buying. It was delivered the day before and I called for a price match and they wouldn't do anything because their policy is to match only up to 7 days. Poor customer service. I won't be a return customer.

name: Mark Hall
text: I ordered track shoes online and made the mistake of doing ground shipping instead of paying more for expedited shipping. That is my fault. The very next day, I called their customer service and asked to change to expedited shipping and pay the difference, but they told me it was too late that my shoes had already been processed and were waiting pick up for shipping. The ground shipping is supposed to be 4-6 business days. I checked today and the expected delivery date is the end of day on 4/26. That is 7 business days!! I ordered on 4/17, spoke with them on 4/18, and I still won’t have my child’s shoes for 7 business days. Their shipping is awful! It starts with UPS, and then moves to USPS, so UPS told me it doesn’t qualify for “true” tracking. It cost money, is unreliable, slow, and in the end my daughter won’t have her shoes in time for her track meet. In today’s Amazon world this company is going to get left behind with such a terrible online process. Lesson learned...the hard way!

name: Matt Norman

Misled on ETA's, cancelled orders without notice due to shipping a ball to my son out of state, order information wrongly input over the phone resulting in a wrongly shipped order. Tried contacting reps via phone and chat, all completely useless and unaccountable for a very lacking job.

I’ll talk to the girl that packaged the order and have her call you on Monday.” 3 days later no call or follow up. Just goes to show they don’t care about their customers by all of the negative reviews.

text: I wanted to go in to just look around well the customer service was HORRIBLE and they were starring me up and down I just got done cleaning so I didn’t have any top notch clothes on to go look well I still go in they look at me the whole time like I was gonna steal something and I’d never do that and I heard a customer in the dressing room saying the pants were to much and the worker said yea well they are worth every penny with a attitude and she ended up not buying nothing either. they were over priced and very cluttered I didn’t buy anything and don’t plan on going back.

resp.text: Hey Nicole! I'm so sorry that you had such a bad experience. We try to give our customers a more personalized shopping experience and train our employees to be active and engage with customers so that we can offer our help if needed! We know there is a lot of inventory in the store and it can get overwhelming so we try to be as diligent as we can to meet our customers needs and be able to help them find everything they are looking for. It never has anything to do with thinking you are doing something wrong! If you have any questions or concerns please give us a call.

name: Skyler Brown
text: If I could give them negative stars I would!! Pricing is way over the top (not that I can’t afford) for the quality everything is. I came in to shop for a photoshoot, as I was trying items on, I was told I was too small to shop here and i needed to go to a child’s clothing store! Hated the attitudes I was given and felt so claustrophobic in there! Will not return after my experience!

name: Amanda George
text: Best selection of Z-supply and other boutique brands.

name: Ryan VanSickle
text:
If you like spending $100 on jeans only to wear them twice before they rip then have the store refuse to do anything for you, this is the place for you.

At that particular price point, one would expect better quality products, along with better customer service. Sadly, neither were delivered. I asked who I believe to be the manager if she would be ok with spending $100 on jeans and only wear them twice then throw them away. She said, "not necessarily." So I asked, "but you are ok with me and your other customers doing that?" After that she simply answered a disingenuous "I'm sorry" over and over until I left, with no solutions or answers. Her pretentious and discourteous attitude spoke volumes about the customer service, or lack there of, at the store.

I certainly won't be back, but I encourage others to read the reviews prior to visiting (spoiler alert: mine isn't the only one like this). In today's retail atmosphere of "shop small", I would expect and appreciate genuine customer service.

name: Michelle Brakefield

name: Cornesia Lewis
text: I want to start by saying the only reason I give it 4 stars is because the staff wasn’t welcoming at the time, love the clothes but it made me want to shop else where because of how the staff was. When I went to try on stuff, which I was iffy about (covid-19), but I have to try on certain stuff. At first i was the only one in the store for a little while before a second person came in, I asked about the dressing room, girl went in to clean it sanitize which I appreciate. But if I’m about to buy something & I’m trying it on why is the staff asking how long I got in the dressing room she knocked on door more than once , like was there a time limit or something? she kept asking me other people need to try on stuff I’m thinking like it’s about 4 other rooms & then they told me once I go in I can’t go in but once.  With that being said I made sure that I took in all what I could & wanted to purchase. Like don’t rush I’m trying multiple pieces, come out it’s like one person with two other people sitting including a man, which he is not trying on stuff waiting. Manager kept making small comments to staff hardly spoke when I came in....I wanted to give them a piece of my mind but wasn’t worth my time,  hence store was only open about 45 mins when I arrived so I don’t want to hear anything about a long day. Would have never went into store but shop online but I needed something I didn’t want to wait To ship only to arrive with limited selection. The world is already in a crisis to have people like this   Someone would love to have your job & customers are what keeping it open.

text:
Never go to this store.
I applied for a credit card with my first purchase and got approved. When I returned my items I kept a shirt. Paid for the shirt with a check. The following month I received the statement. It showed I owed 82.19. No one will listen that I returned those items. Apparently they stand firm on saying you owe them instead of investigating. THEY DO NOT CARE. ONE BIT. IF THEY SAY YOU OWE IT YOU OWE IT OR THEY DESTROY YOUR NICE CREDIT SCORE. The employees either took the items themselves or made a mistake when refunding them. Either way, New York & Company does not care.

text: 2day was not a good experience...I have been shopping with this company since it was Lerner's and never have I ever😕 only reason I'm giving 2stars is because one clerk greeted ma as I walked in as well as when I left...and note I was only making a return with receipts and before return policy dates!

name: Marquittia Bradford
text: There is a cashier there... her name may be Shelby.  I forgot to ask when I was checking out because she'd left for the day heading to the UAB library (I overheard her talking).  I called this morning to get her name but April (who said she was a manager) told me that she couldn't give me her name. The young lady this review is about is  African American and wears her hair in a natural afro type style. This young lady is a determent to your establishment.  Upon me arriving, I walked to the rear to inquire about a restroom.  In a very annoyed tone, she says "Ma'am is there something I can help you with back there?"  I walked from the dressing room and said "I was looking for a bathroom." I've visited the NYCO at the Summit and familiar with the bathroom being located near the dressing room.  Very snippy, she said "our bathroom is not open to the public try The Children's Place".  I said thank you and she begin to talk very sternly to another customer about a coupon that she could NOT accept.  So I left to head to the Children's place, and returned to hear this lady now talking to another customer about the mis-placement of a blouse/shirt.  I was eavesdropping, but I didn't have to try hard because the cashier has a loud, stern, firm voice and it echoed thru the building.  She pretty much was telling the patron that she would not give her a shirt for a price just because it was located in an area that had a sign for a less expensive cost. The message she conveyed may have been true, but again, her TONE and ATTITUDE were horrible.  The customer left quielty.  But that was not the end of the convo for your cashier.  Two other cashiers were talking in whispered voices with the young lady and they seemed to be trying to calm her down.  In her overly loud voice the cashier (again I think her name is Shelby but I do not recall), this young lady repeatedly yelled "she doesnt know who I AM!  I could be the regional manager!  I could have really shown her who I was, but I'm trying to be professional.  She and her mother...and she is this, and she is that...."  I was shopping in your store and there were at least 4 other customers inside the store at the time.  So her tone definitely disturbed our shopping experience. I just needed this to be known because it appears that this young lady thinks that her behavior is appropriate.   I was happy to see her go because I did not want her to check me out at the cash register. I hope the lady she was rude to reports her as well. It was inappropriate and lacked professionalism.

text: This was a 50th Wedding Anniversary with a bridal party from 5 different states with 5 different sizes, shoes and accessories. This is the place to handle anything. Any issue was rectified immediately by the Tuscaloosa management, especially Shanty. An example, the shoe size was not right, they had it shipped to the women's front door. But more importantly, their calm attitude and work ethic  was of great value. Kept the bride and girls at peace as details were worked out quickly. Everything worked out lovely and everyone looked great! Thank you Shanty and staff. We had a wonderful time working with you.

name: Amber Barger
text: I went to David's Bridal in Tuscaloosa on Saturday. I didn't have an appointment. The girls got me right back. Shelby was my stylist & she was awesome. I told her exactly what I wanted; which was a dress with sleeves.  I showed her pictures from online & she found all the dresses. I'm a plus size bride so I was scared; I wouldn't have a lot of selections. I was very wrong; they had dresses in stock for any size bride. Shelby found me three great dresses. There was a dress online that had short sleeves. Shelby let me try on the same dress in strapless & told me she could order it for me with sleeves. Shelby explained payment arrangements & credit options to pay for the dress. Shelby broke everything down in detail for me. Which was very helpful for a new bride with a budget. I was very close to ordering that dress. But, I really wanted to try it on with the sleeves. I was so impressed with David's Bridal in Tuscaloosa; I made an appointment the same day at the David's Bridal in Hoover. I was thinking Hoover would have more dresses with sleeves & possibly have that dress with sleeves to try on. That was the worst idea ever. The store in Hoover is a huge disappointment for David's Bridal. The customer service needs to be reviewed at the Hoover store. The employees at that store are very unprofessional. After the bad experience at the Hoover store; I started reading reviews & asking friends. Apparently that is common for the David's Bridal in Hoover. If I decide to order through David's Bridal, it will definitely be with the Tuscaloosa David's Bridal. Great job David's Bridal in Tuscaloosa.

text: I loved the experience! My only negative for the day was the limited supply of modest styled dresses for a lower price point.

text: I have bought several formals from this boutique. They are extremely helpful, friendly & there to assist in anyway possible. I will continue to support this local business & look forward to shopping there again soon.

resp.text: Thank you Kelly! You are truly a valued customer of ours! We are so thankful for you! Have a great work trip!

name: Alicia Presley
text:
I needed a dress for an upcoming wedding and this place saved the day!
The selection was great with a mix of reasonably priced items and high end dresses, some still with tags attached.
The ladies were so amazing and helped me start to finish even with my pickiness 😁 I found the perfect one and highly recommend them!

resp.text: We are thrilled you found the perfect dress!

name: Amanda Faye
text: Gorgeous dresses at such reasonable prices! Homecoming, prom, and even some wedding! It's definitely my first stop for formal and semi-formal wear, and their casual clothes are so cute! I recommend it to all of my friends.

resp.text: Thank you, Amanda! We appreciate your business!

name: Allen Dobbs
text: Very helpful, and took time for us even as busy as they were, as if we were the only one's there! Awesome experience.  Will be back

resp.text: Thank you so much! We’re thrilled that you are pleased!

name: Susan Kay
text: Got the dresses I went there for. Great selection. I did end up feeling a bit rushed to finish up with the dressing room so someone else could use it..... Which I get, however.... I rushed up my decision, made the purchase and while still sitting in the parking lot the teenagers I had hurried up for were walking back out to their vehicles with no purchase made.......wouldn't stop me from shopping again!

resp.text: Susan, we are so sorry you felt rushed, that was not our intent. It does get crazy busy during prom season so we do our best to give everyone equal time in the dressing rooms. Thank you so much for your business and we appreciate your understanding. We’re always striving to improve so thank you for the feedback!

name: Lisa Potter
text: Don’t lie on the phone and say you don’t do consignment when it’s right on your website. Also, try not to sound so rude when answering the phone like it takes every ounce of you to be kind.

resp.text:
Lisa, we’re sorry you had a negative experience. We do consignment yes, but we don’t purchase items outright. Consignment means you still own the item (we don’t buy it from you) and then when it sells you get a percentage of the sale. So sorry for the confusion. We also apologize for coming across as rude, we were short handed today with people waiting to check out and our
human-ness must have come through, thank you for understanding and for your review. Have a great weekend!!

name: Nancy Godwin
text: Great value! Wonderful service! Nice stuff!

resp.text: Thank you, Nancy!

name: Meshay P
text: If your looking to get rid of some clothes that are gently used,  this is a place to take them to make some extra $$. I didn't like the fact you have to check to see if your items sold & the owner gets rude when you call to check too much, even though she set the system up that way🙄

resp.text: Hi Meshay P, we aim to deliver a great experience but as humans we sometimes miss the mark. We’ll strive to do better. Have a great day!

text: I called this store after 5pm looking for specific kind of boots for my toddlers (that weren't in stock in our surrounding area) and the sales woman said they had the two sizes we were looking for and they was fully stocked. I then asked her what time do they close and she said 8pm (even though the website said 9pm) so I told the sales woman that we were coming from Montgomery to get the boots. Myself, my three year old toddlers, and their dad drive over an hour to come purchase the boots arriving at 7:35pm to see that they have already closed!! This is the most unprofessional situation I have ever dealt with!! It was a waste of time and money!! I will be calling corporate Monday morning because this is unacceptable !!

name: Jeremy Baker
text: Nobody acknowledged I had even walked in the store. No greeting or anything. Store was a disaster. I found a pair of shoes I liked. There were 3 pairs all the same. 1 pair had a sale sticker attached. I even checked to make sure someone hadn't pulled it off another shoe box and attached to this box. Took them to the counter and cashier rang me up and told me they were not on sale that it was a mistake and asked me to pay full price. I refused to pay the retail price. When I asked why a sale sticker was placed on the box the cashier told me they went off sale over a month ago. She wasn't nice about it either. How about going through and checking the inventory every once in awhile so issues like this don't happen in the future. Because of the attitudes and poor customer service, I went across the street and bought a pair of shoes from Hibbett Sports.

name: Latasha Pippins
text: I am so glad that all of these reviews are so favorable. On Saturday October 26, 2019 my 23 year old daughter, my 9 year old daughter, and my 1 year old granddaughter went into this store. After browsing and finding a costume but not all of the needed accessories they left without making a purchase.They returned after visiting another Halloween store to purchase the costume. The manager then accused her of shoplifting and admitted to following them around the store. After my daughter willingly allowed her to look in her purse, finding nothing, the manager still called the police. My daughter stayed and waited on the police asking to see any video showing her shoplifting. The police officer then examined her purse and found nothing.The police officer asked them to leave and said that the manager did not want them to return to the store. I'm a little confused because I did not know that you could be banned from a store for trying to spend money, because my silly daughter was still wanting to purchase the costume.The manager never apologized or admitted to being mistaken, but she did say "that she know what "you people" do and that she was going to jail and told my 9 year old that she and her niece were going to DHR." I'm glad that the people that had these great  experiences were not the "you people"  that steal. I do not recommend that people of color shop at this store our money is no good there. I GIVE THEM NO STARS, I ACTUALLY NEED 5 OF THEM BACK, BUT THE COMPUTER WANT LET ME POST WITHOUT ONE!!!!

However, not good enough for me to forget an AM whose immediate response to a customer not knowing return policies is to call the police! And then have the nerve to ask if it's "ok" to hang up. Like, yeah, I'm gonna go bath salts and attack you over your $30 shoes.

Come on, it was totally a power trip because I called her out on being rude. However, I'd like to emphasize everyone else I talked to was very nice and pleasant so it seems to be a management issue more than an employee issue.

name: Conner's Corner Watches and Militaria
text: Dropped off a bag to get a new strap put on, was told 6-8 weeks. After 8 weeks, I called and was informed "We didn't mean 8 weeks on the dot, it'll be another week". After nearly THIRTEEN WEEKS, with NO phone call, I just had to pick up my bag and get a refund. They could not do as they said they could, and NOTHING had been done to my bag. They then chose to notify us that the person that was supposed to be working on my bag was fired. EXTREMELY disappointed in GEM Shoe Repair.

name: Jon J. Cardwell
text:
Got a pair of Neil M boots (Dawson). This brown leather dress boot with genuine welt construction is not only handsome, it may also be the most comfortable footwear I’ve ever put on my size 12 pods. The full-grain premium brown leather presents a vintage look appropriate for dress or casual occasions, which is versatility I absolutely love. I love this footwear.

The service from Gem Shoe Repair parallels the care, quality and craftsmanship of the  Neil M line, which is what you’d want (and expect) from a shoe store with such high-end offerings. The staff at Gem allowed me to try on nearly a dozen pair of shoes before I finally settled on the Neil M boots. They were kind, friendly, helpful and genuinely concerned with my feet receiving the very best care and quality I could ever receive from footwear and foot care professionals.

I most highly recommend Gem Shoe Repair and will see them first anytime and every time I am looking to make a purchase which is in some way connected to my feet. Great job folks! Thanks so much! 5+ Stars!

text: Very disappointed.  After calling and being assured that they "clean thousand dollar boots everyday" and they knew what they were doing. I took in my leather wallet to be cleaned. After about two weeks I got a call saying my wallet was ready. When I got there to pick it up, my heart sunk. My wallet looked as if someone tried to paint it with paint that was way too light in color and had what appeared to be brush strokes all over it. I was heart broken. The wallet was a gift from a friend and means a great deal to me, not to mention it cost over $100. Thankfully, I was able to find someone who could make it look slightly better. Unfortunately, it's still not the same. I would never recommend GEM Shoe repair to anyone.

text: We went in this morning needing 2 suits for a funeral. The store was busy, phones were ringing, yet we received the most fantastic, personable customer service. Both pants required hemming, which was to be completed by Monday. We called about an hour later to let them know services were Sunday, and the pants were already hemmed! The staff offered their condolences, and were truly a joy to interact with. The sale was awesome, and they let us know how to get the most for our money. We will go back to this store every time the need arises. Thank you for everything.

Their regular prices are a bit high but there is almost always a sale going on.

name: Kelly Turner
text: Had the best experience getting my custom suit because of the amazing staff at the brookwood location. Ronald made our family feel like we were home. He took all the stress out of acquiring our wedding attire. Thank you so much Ronald .. every jos a bank in the nation needs you!!!

name: Greg Pennington
text: Hey Joseph A Bank, why don't you just sell each individual piece of clothing at a reasonable price instead of clustering multiple items when you pay a lot of money for one item. So confusing just simmer down a bit. I thought that you would like a review with some down to earth language!

name: Andrew Hamiter
text:
I purchased a shirt from this location and came back to exchange the shirt for a larger size without a receipt.  First, I was told that they do not return items that have been worn.  Moments later, the "manager" told me that they would buy it back for 50%.  I asked the "manager", "is it not true that you send shirts to the dry cleaners after they have been tried on?"  He replied, "yes".  I asked, "but, you can't take this shirt back and have it dry cleaned with the rest of them?"  He shook his head.  I asked for the manager and he said, "I am the manager".

they took my information and put it in the system when I purchased the shirt, so there is a record of my purchase.

The last experience that i will ever have with the store left a sour taste.  The sales staff, mainly the "manager", left me highly disappointed in their professionalism, honesty, and concern to make it right.  I drove to another location and they exchanged my item for a larger size without too much hassle.

My advice:  Go to another brand name store for quality service.  My friend, who is a former Jos A.
Bank employee, recommended that I take my future business to Brooks Brothers at the Summit.  I forward that advice to all of you.

name: Robert Levy
text: Great men's clothes and employees. "Regular price" is rediculously high. Only buy with good sale

name: Kasey Lange
text: I had the absolute worst experience at the Brookwood Village Jos A. Bank. I used them for my groom and groomsman suits for my June wedding. Every time one of the men would go to get sized or pick up something, I was called and asked questions that were answered by simply looking at their computers. I felt like I was constantly just telling them how to do their job. Also, some of the suits still did not fit properly even after getting fitted. I would not recommend them to anyone!!

text:
I wish I had read the reviews before I went. I had a terrible experience there while purchasing a gift for a friend. The staff at best was indifferent to my presence. When I checked out the salesman wouldn't even look at me or make eye contact. It seems ridiculous to be so upset, but part of the reason I went to Jos. A. Bank was because I wanted knowledgable advice.

I do think the tie and socks I bought are nice, but next time I'll go somewhere else.

name: David Barr
text: Good quality clothing at reasonable prices.

name: Carson Landers
text:
I normally don't do reviews, but I've had so many bad experience with three Jos. A. Banks stores that I'm going to go on an adventure. Here I go.

Part 1:
This particular store was the worst of all. My wife (now) and I walked in, walked up to an employee that was just standing there drinking a soda not doing anything, and told him that we were getting married - that we needed to buy 12 suits for their buy 1 get 3 free sale. That's right. 12 suits. He looks at us with a blank stare and just points off in the distance and says that we can look over there for some.

Later on, we get someone that actually knows how to communicate. He doesn't know how to fuit someone for a suit even though he tries but does horribly, but then he keeps running off to the first guy we walked up to to tell him sorry for taking his customer. We were never his customer to begin with.

My wife and I were completely stressed out after this. I could go on about other details, but in the end we walked out. We were going to buy 12 suits, but they couldn't care less. I haven't had this poor of service in a long time even though buying a suit is where customer service is supposed to be very important.

Meet me again in Part 2 at the Huntsville, AL Bridge Street store.

name: Y Liu
text:
Manager Paul has poor customer skills and called police on me to ask me leave. Paul is very unreasonable and has his sole management discretion about me (Asian and new to America).
Police told me not to come in this store ever again just because manager Paul wanted so for no reasons. It really hurts a new customer's feelings.

Bryan,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Rest assured this will be addressed with the regional and store management team of our Birmingham, AL location for review and training purposes. We’d love to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you’d like to discuss this with us in greater detail, please email your preferred contact info and the best time to reach you to at JABListens@josabank.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
JAB Listens

name: Doug Zeiger
text: Our wedding was planned for May 2nd. Covid-19 became the reality and there was disaster after disaster. We cancelled, replanned, downsized, and resized to accommodate the changing world around us. At the start, I had expert advice and help from Ben who fashioned two outfits for the preceding parties. The styling, the fit, and the attention to detail was superb. If you like things done right, go to Shaia's. But the story continues, for the actual wedding day we had a tuxedo picked out that was being made in Italy. The factory had to shut down due to the virus and in the few weeks leading up to the wedding, I was facing quite the dilemma. Ben called me for a special appointment to come in and see what could be done from what was on hand at the store. Ben and Ken went far beyond the extra mile to make sure I was not only clothed for my wedding, but the tuxedo was classy, comfortable, and contained the right amount of original. I cannot recommend Shaia's any higher. There were even a few other minor disasters with needing a haircut and my brides' dress needing last minute alterations that we took to Ken because he just got things done. This is where you can truly see Ken's kindness. He helped us in a huge way during our time of need. Shaia's is a five star store from every angle thanks to a helpful, accommodating, and knowledgeable staff.

resp.text: Thanks Doug for your sincere review. Congratulations to you and your wife, we can't wait to see the photos.

name: James Crenshaw
text: Shaia's is a family owned men's clothing store that is unparalleled as far as service and selection. The store itself makes finding clothes/shoes fun and interactive, while the exceptional staff go out of their way to help you and ultimately build relationships which will last forever. My father first went to Shaia's in the early 1970's where he bought his first nice sports coat and has been a return customer since. The family atmosphere is one of a kind, and makes this store truly special.

name: Sam Willingham
text: How lucky Birmingham Alabama is to have Shaia's. They have the best selection of finer men's clothing short of Italy. Rarely do you find a store like this that treat's you like family. Do yourself a favor and check them out.

text: Shaia's is the best men's clothing store with the best clothes and best staff.  The members of the sales staff never talk down to me. They always give me the dignity, sense of equality, and respect they give all their clients and customers.

name: Will R
text: I have visited shades for more than 60 years. They have always been top of the line and in clothing. They carry a wide variety to suit many customers.

name: Shawn David
text: My husband has only recently been interested in "nice clothes." He's known Ken Shaia for years but we've not shopped there regularly. I decided to take him there for his 50th birthday a couple of years ago. Not only did we have a great time, we got so many timeless pieces that my husband loves. I continue to shop there and build his wardrobe which is the beauty of shopping at Shaia's: nothing trendy; all classic, tailored pieces that make him feel like a million bucks. We can call Shaia's, describe an upcoming event, and they'll have the perfect ensemble put together when we get there or, better yet, something that will go perfectly with the pieces we've already bought. A great place!

name: George
text:
WOW! Absolutely positively the best shopping experience I have ever had. I have an athletic build and finding clothes that fit my physique is impossible. Well, until I met Greg Flowers. He was my consultant, and he gave me the most knowledgable, helpful & educational journey about properly fitting clothes, what a tailor can and cannot do, and how to layer elements together into a cohesive personal style that is all your own. Greg has in-depth knowledge of all the products in the store, how they fit, which brands flatter certain body types, how to build a cohesive wardrobe and what will look good on you in a way that fits your personal style. The atmosphere at the store is relaxing and makes shopping feel like you are strolling around at home chatting with very knowledge and suave friends.

After one visit I am a full convert. If you have trouble finding clothes that not only fit but also complement your very hard-earned physique, then do yourself a favor and go see Greg.

name: Ultreya Park
text:
Great deals again today, $5 espadrilles and a red rain jacket. So busy, no time for them to keep up w/picking up. LOTS of variety here. Friendly staff.

Few months ago, extra 50% off clearance and a lot to choose from. Picked up a jean jacket @ $9.50, sunglasses @ $5.53, gorgeous-blue cabbie hat @ $3.50, black wrap-type sweater-shrug, a crop sweatshirt, both @ $4.50, and for $2.50 each, a bright pink crossbody bag in shiny dark pink, and black flat dressy shoes that were not marked clearance, expected to pay $17.90! The manager was super-friendly, made sure we knew about the sale, offered help. The store was cleaner and more organized than sometimes. Ran out of time or I am sure I would have found more.

name: Reema Eqab
text: !!Completely disorganized and terrible service!! The customer service at this location was the worst I've see in a long time. Most of the employees were on their phones. When I went to the dressing room, the girl, without looking up from her phone, said "go ahead"  I was hesitant because she didn't ask to count my clothes. When I left the dressing room, I asked her where she wanted me to put my clothes, and she didn't answer. Then I said "do you want them here?" and she says, "put them over there." And as soon as I left, I heard her do a long attitude exhale. There was no organization in the clothes either, the shirts and pants were literally mixed around everywhere on all the racks. The jewelry section wasn't any better, the necklaces were all tangled together. We don't have a forever 21 in my location, so I decided to come here, but I don't think I'll waste my time next time. I'll just go to the Destin location.

name: Haleigh Lynch
text: I used to love this location but just recently walked out empty handed because the line was from the register and about 20 customers long which I would have been happy to wait in because I understood on Fridays at around 5 pm is a busy time what I did not understand was the multiple employees on two registers playing and about 5 employees near the exit that went to the parking lot walking in and out playing with the security sensors on their name badges. I understand not everyone is comfortable with working on a register and understand when there's down time to have fun but when a line is almost to the mall entrance? No thanks, I will take my business to Rue 21 and go to Panama City Beach  in Florida and shop at that Forever 21 location to get better customer service!

Never got my refund, emailed them, never received a reply, called them again, was told the same thing, 5-10 business days for the refund to go through. Still nothing. And it's almost Christmas and everytime it gets close to November, I'm just so upset about it. I didn't call my bank bc I thought they were going to fix the issue. Just so disappointed. Haven't shopped there since. I normally order my stuff online because I don't like going into the stores, very messy and unorganized. And after this incident, just really don't want to work with people like that.

name: Melissa Morris
text: If I could give more than five stars, I would! I went in for hiking shoes, not having done my research beforehand, and the sales associate knew her stuff and helped me. I can say two weeks later, after just finishing multiple hikes in Yosemite National Park and other challenging locations, these are the best hiking shoes that I have ever worn-water proof and all! They are perfect for what I needed. The associate also helped me find everyday shoes and the owner herself tried them on with me, so I could see them “on a model”, which was so incredibly helpful. The selection is wonderful, the staff is wonderful, and the owner was a delight to meet and be helped by, during a busy weekend day. I will never go anywhere else for shoes. Huntsville is super blessed to have this store!

name: Jill Campbell
text: You have saved my life! I had knee replacement surgery in November and afterward I developed Planters Fasciitis as well as Neuropathy.  I came into Valley Sole in pain in February. You took the time to find the perfect fit in Birkenstock’s and Aetrix. I was finally able to walk without pain! After about 2 weeks I could continue my knee physical therapy without foot pain. I could flatten my leg without heel pain.  I continue to wear my Birkenstock’s around the house because it just plain fills better.  My feet feel better at the end of the day! Other shoes, your feet hurt at the end of the day. You have a customer for life! Just bought 2 pair of Naot’s with the same foot support.  And they don’t look like everybody else’s shoes from department stores. Thank you so much!

name: Tonya & Robert Bickerstaff
text: First of all, I will start by saying that the store appeared very clean and has a good selection of different brands of shoes that are displayed nicely and I was greeted before I even got halfway through the door.  But those are the only positive things that I can say about my experience.  The sales lady immediately asked what I was looking for and I told her that I would just like to look around for a few minutes if that was ok because this was my first time in the store.  Well, I guess that wasn’t ok because she started asking me all of these questions.  I told her that I wanted to look at a pair of Birkenstock but that I had never had a pair before so I needed help with the sizing and no one in my area carried them and I had driven over an hour to come and look at them.  She immediately tried to get me to look at another name brand and told me she liked them better but I told her that I was there to look at Birkenstock.  I guess I got the wrong idea about this store, since I didn’t know my size I thought maybe they would measure my feet and actually try to help with a size but I left just as about confused as I did when I went in.  She kept changing her mind about what size she thought I needed.  She ended up telling me they didn’t have my size and color in stock which is ok because by this point I probably would have not bought them anyway and I don’t know how she even knew about the size when she kept changing her mind.  She told me that since I had never had Birkenstock before that there was going to be a break in period and that I still needed to look at the other name brand that she was trying to push.  I told her that I wasn’t stupid enough to pay $135 for a pair of shoes without reading up on them and doing a little research and that was exactly what I had done with the Birkenstock that I was interested in.  I wasn’t wanting to spend that kind of money that day just because I had nothing better to do, I knew exactly what I was wanting to look at.  She told me that she didn’t like Birkenstock because they hurt her feet but before I could get out of the store, she told me that she had two pairs that she loved.  What???  And if this was not already bad enough, at one point she left me standing barefoot in the middle of the store next to the Birkenstock display so she could go follow some lady around that was making a return that she had apparently helped a day or two before.  There was another associate that could have helped her.  And my sales lady was walking around with the shoe that I was needing to try on.  Needless to say, I don’t think I’ll ever be back and I would much rather shop at the small locally owned stores and with the craziness of the last year, you think they would appreciate your business but this store doesn’t need to count on me to keep them in business.

name: Peter Speak
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. They had the shoes I was looking for.

name: Lynn
text: Very nice store but extremely limited men’s selection.

name: Laura Stiegler
text: I love Naot shoes and Valley Sole.  Everyone is friendly and helpful.

name: b wilson
text:
Valley Sole is AMAZING!  I have been shopping here for years! I will never shop for shoes anywhere else.  Holly & Julie are a wonderful team, they put their heart & soul into finding the perfect shoe for you.
Every shoe I own comes from Valley Sole  <3

name: Lela Morrow
text: Knew exactly what I was looking for and Valley Sole had come highly recommended.  The moment I entered the store, the associate was incredibly rude.  I brushed it off and gave her the benefit of doubt —everyone has a bad day.  However, the encounter continued when I told her which shoe & what size I needed.  She quickly popped off implying that I had never worn said brand, etc.  A younger associate came over to help and was very nice.  While VS had the exact shoe I was looking for (and I would have purchased in more than one color; I even asked to try on the colors I intended to purchase) and while I always try to shop local, I left the store—which is something I would normally never do—and went just down the road where I was able to make my purchases.   Small businesses hold a special place in my heart however if I am belittled from the moment I walk in the door, that’s certainly not a place that I want to do business.

resp.text: I am so sorry to hear about your experience. Yes, we all have bad days but our goal is always to not only help our customers find the perfect shoe but also to make a friend and be a bright spot in their day. Please send me an email to julie@valleysole.com so that we can make it right. Thank you for supporting local businesses, especially during this crazy time.

name: Christy Davies
text: I love Valley Sole!  Julie is so knowledgeable about the different brands and works really hard to find the perfect shoe for you!  I will keep shopping here because my feet have never been so comfortable and the customer service is the best!

name: Marcie Grossman Smith
text: What a treat it is to find an independent retailer who cares about their Customers! Julie and her team are truly lovely, charming, and dedicated. I feel fortunate to have accidentally wandered into Valley Sole and will return the next time I’m in the area for sure!

name: Misty McNeill
text: Love this shoe store! They carry all the best brands for your feet!! Wish there were more like it!  We need more quality professionals providing stylish but good for your feet shoes!

name: Denise Kidd
text: I love shopping at Valley Sole!  They have a wonderful selection of shoes of all types.....dressy and casual and offer wonderful personal assistance.  Her shoes are not your run of the mill shoes and are extremely well made and wear like a glove!  I live in Fayetteville and drive an hour just to shop at this store.  I love recommending them to folks especially when they tell me how cute my shoes are!!!

name: Suzanne Stogner Comer
text: Best people, best place, best selection, best customer service! Shop local with Julie and her crew at Valley Sole❤️

name: Michelle Lee
text: I LOVE THIS STORE! It's my favorite shoe store! The staff is amazing! They sell more than just Birkenstocks! Go and give them a try you wont be disappointed!

Visited when out of town and in a crunch to get shoes...

Great selection of shoes! Employees were very helpful and went above and beyond to help me get what I was looking for! You won’t be disappointed!

text: I was in the area for business and stopped by this awesome shoe store.  Great selection and amazing customer service! Wish you guys were closer to home!
