text: Cutest store. Great selection and awesome customer service! Will definitely be back!

name: Leslie Hamm
text: Love this store! They have a great selection of shoes. Not only if the staff friendly, but they are very knowledgeable about the brands they sell. Can’t wait to go back!

name: Emily Futransky
text: Happened upon this gem recently. Can't say enough good things. Awesome selection, lovely service.

name: Tammie Berzett
text: Valley Sole is an amazing shoe store.  It is unfortunate there are people in our society that stoop to low life tactics to try to ruin someone's business.  To the owner of Valley Sole.....keep up the wonderful service you provide to the Huntsville community.

name: S. Beltran
text:
I received outstanding personal service here in my search to find comfortable shoes. The friendly salesperson recognized when the shoe was a touch too big before I did! I found three pairs of perfect fitting shoes but alas, I only budgeted for one pair and a pair of Birkenstocks for my son. My husband now wants a pair of Birks. :)

I can’t believe it took me four years of driving past it on Airport before walking into this shoe store. I can’t wait to buy my next pair of shoes at Valley Soles! :)

name: Katie Thompson
text: Great store and tons of selection!  Came in for Birkenstocks, and left wanting so much more after trying on some different styles of different types of shoes.  They are so kind and helpful.  They truly want you to have happy feet and to feel good in your shoes.  Extremely personalized and very patient.  Can't say enough great things!  Definitely worth a visit ... you'll probably even walk out wearing your new shoes!

name: Brea Harris
text: I have looked everywhere for comfortable professional shoes to stand on for 10-hour days, and nothing seemed to work for me. I walked into Valley Shoes, and Julie listened well, understood my problem, and immediately took me to a new brand to try. The shoes she recommended fit so well and were so comfortable (and so cute!), and I'm excited to try them out at work. She was so helpful and friendly and even added a little extra padding because my foot is so thin. Best service I've had at a shoe store by far!!

name: Jackie Rettick
text: Great service, wonderful selection. Will definitely be returning upon future visits!

name: Ruth Martin
text: Shoe selection was great however I'm rating a one for service because when I walked in and stayed for a while looking around no one ever acknowledged me or asked if I needed help. It was very disappointing because I saw two pairs I would liked to have tried on but after 10 minutes with no offer of help I just left. They weren't very busy. The girls working there could have at least said, I will be with you in a few minutes.

resp.text:
Ruth,
You are absolutely right and I am so sorry. We have several new employees as we grow and expand but greeting a customer (even when you are helping other customers) is day 1 of training and should not happen ever. Will you please send me an email to julie@Valleysole.com so that I can get more info about your visit and get this corrected immediately? I hope that you will try shopping with us again and if you let me know when you are coming I would love to personally work with you. Thank you for for getting in touch and I sure hope you’ll come back.
Sincerely,
Julie

name: AM B
text: Awesome selection & service. Julie was an amazing help & I love, love, LOVE my new shoes!

name: Creative Palette
text: My 88 yr young mom gets swollen feet and ankles but still wants pretty shoes. Valley Sole hooked her up with some great sandals by revere that have strap extensions just for that problem. Great service! I love bringing my mom here for shoes because they are comfy, good looking and help keep her moving safely.

name: cj angeleyes
text: Excellent shoe selection & customer service! Support your local business owners! ✨

name: Tami Pearson
text: I can always find the shoes I want and the employees are always ready to help

name: Paige Parker
text: I had a wonderful experience at Valley Sole! I have plantar fasciitis/heel spurs & the ladies at Valley Sole knew exactly what I needed. They were so attentive & helpful. They have a great selection of shoes. But the best part is that for the first time in months, my feet feel great. I will definitely be back!

name: Paula Mulqueen
text: The service was attentive and friendly.  There is a wide selection of brands and styles. I had a good variety to choose from even though my foot is wide and difficult to fit.  The prices are very competitive.   I will definitely be back next time a need a pair of shoes.

name: michele pearce
text: I love this store!  I started calling on them as a sales representative and after spending time in the store, was soon very impressed with the professional sales people working there.  They know their products so well and treat every customer like they are the most important person.  And the products... they have such stylish shoes, boots and accessories, i can't help but shop there, even when i am supposed to be on a sales call.  I bought the cutest pair of Bussola boots last month and every time i wear them, I get a ton of compliments.  I highly recommend Valley Birkenstock Sole for anyone who enjoys a great shopping experience and wants the latest styles.

name: Meredith
text: Very disappointed in my experience today. I have been here before and the employees were helpful. I have read amazing reviews about customer service. Today, however, it was awful. I walked in and the two employees sat behind the desk and did not get up to offer any help. One was on their phone. In a store like this, I feel like I should not have to ask to try on a pair of shoes, I am usually being helped and they will offer to get me some to try on. It is not like a department store where you sometimes have to hunt down an employee. I probably should have just gone to one anyway. If I was the owner and had seen my employees being that lazy I probably would have fired them on the spot. Today, I was willing to drop $200 on shoes, and they had the ones I was looking for, but there was no way they were getting my sale.

resp.text:
Meredith,

I am so glad that you've had good experiences in the past and our goal is always to provide excellent customer service as well as unique products. I am so sorry for your bad experience yesterday. You are absolutely right, our ladies should be on their feet and ready to help! I have spoken with all of them and addressed this so that this will not happen again. We so appreciate you shopping local and I would love to personally help you next time you come in.

Thanks,
Julie

name: Lois Flowers
text: Love Valley Sole...the only store that has the best selection and cutest shoes that my customized orthotics can fit in.

name: Mentone Inn
text: I own. Bed n breakfast,  I am on my feet 16-18 hours a day sometimes.  My cousin told me about Valley Sole in Huntsville. As soon as I sleepless into the store the owner and staff were very helpful and made suggestions based on what I told them.  I was blown away by the customer service.  She made sure the fit was right and the correct support on my arch.  I live 75 miles away , but I will be coming back ,

name: Carolyn Seaman
text: I just had a great shopping experience at this store. I am very hard to fit and have literally been looking for a cute casual shoe with support for three months. Not only did they have something that fit me, but I had a choice! It was busy, but the staff was attentive and friendly. I will definitely go back.

name: Elizabeth Sheep
text: EXCELLENT customer service and great selection!  Will certainly be back!

name: Paula Dickinson
text: I've been here several times and like it more each time I shop.  I have really bad feet and have found quite a selection of stylish shoes that cater to your individual problem.  They also carry really comfortable orthotics for your old shoes.  The best thing about this shoe store is the service.  A clerk stays with you from the time you come in until you leave, helps you on and off with the shoes, etc.  They can special order a certain size or width and really try to satisfy you.  My feet are happy and it's nice to know there's a store here in Huntsville for people with special feet.

name: Daniel A. Williams
text: Great owner, great selection! Love this place

name: lorena iacobone
text: Great selection and awesome owners!! Will definitely be back!!

name: Zack Cullison
text: Drove all the way from Athens because they wouldn’t answer there phone. Apparently they don’t do that anymore.  Why put your phone number out there if you aren’t gonna answer it. It was better when it was the Birkenstock store.

name: Allison Ott
text:
I came in looking for good work shoes to help my bad back and I found exactly what I needed. The owner was very helpful, she helped me find exactly what I needed. She didn't help me out just for her benefit, it was to provide me with good shoes. Very pleased with my experience and would recommend them to anyone.
- Jesus Cordero

name: Julia Conner
text: Service was fantastic!  Sales staff very patient and worked with me until I got just the right pair of boots.  Highly recommend.

name: M F
text: A GREAT place to purchase shoes of ANY kind!  Not only Birkenstocks....they sell many other brands and styles for all occasions. Comfortable shoes for everyone. Locally owned and they seem to be genuinely concerned about the correct fit and shoe for their customers.  I highly recommend Valley Birkenstock Sole!

name: Wayne Fisher
text: The owners and the staff are awesome!  Very friendly, professional and most important knowledgeable.  Best of all, I now have super comfortable shoes that don't hurt my feet, woohoo!  I would not hesitate to recommend Valley Sole.

name: Erin Margarella
text: Great selection! Great service!

name: Patricia Huebner
text: What a lovely store!  A week ago my daughter-in-law asked me to go with her to buy  Birkenstock sandals for work.  She and I had never been to Valley Sole before and were pleasantly surprised.  Not only did they have a great selection but they were so nice and hospitable and really knew their products.  I got a warm vibe as soon as I walked in.  I ended up buying some for myself too and last weekend, went back with my mother to the store.  There aren't many stores with such nice customer service like this anymore.  Thank you!  I will be back!

name: Destiny Dennis
text: The employees were so helpful. They made sure I got just what I wanted. Definitely recommend this store.

name: Jeannie Vereen
text: I know it sounds dramatic, but the shoes and people at Valley Soul changed my life.  I was unable to sleep or find a comfortable position in which to sit or lie down.  Pain was shooting down my leg and foot and up my back and I was miserable 24/7. Finally I decided to go to Valley Soul to see if they could help me.  The employees listened carefully to what I had to say and then brought out several different shoes for me to try on.  It was amazing! My pain started to subside as soon as I put on their shoes.  Needless to say, I only buy from them now and highly recommend Valley Sole for their excellent caring and competent staff and collection of fabulous shoes!

name: Susan Cornelius
text: I always have a great experience at Valley Sole.  Great service.  They work hard to find the right shoe for me.  The shoes are so comfortable.

name: Pam Stapleton
text: My favorite shoe store! I love the selection -- they always have new styles that are different from the bigger stores. Holly and Julie are so knowledgeable and always help you find the perfect fit and the right inserts if you need them. Birkenstock, Naot, Picolinos, Clouds -- I highly recommend Valley Sole!

name: Ashley DeHaye
text: Really love the selection here and the staff has proven to be very knowledgeable every time I go. They don't just know what shoes they carry, they understand how those shoes fit different types of feet and what shoes might be best for lifestyle.

name: Brandi
text: Great store with a great selection!

name: Heather Reid
text: I had a great experience at Valley Birkenstock. I have wide feet and plantar fasciitis so I have difficulty finding shoes. The sales staff was helpful and knowledgeable and assisted me quickly to find Birkenstocks that fit great! I will definitely go back when I'm ready for another pair of shoes.The shoes are a little more expensive than what you find in department stores but I think this is probably a case of you get what you pay for.

name: Adrian McCobbie
text: Holly is sweet and very heloful. Good service great atmoshpere. I enjoy my time at Valley Sole. I give them 5 stars for service .

name: A. T. Hislop
text: After 20 years it was time to replace my Birkentock Boston's.  I headed to Valley Sole and was greeted with a very helpful and knowledgeable sales staff.  Not knowing what Birkenstock had to offer the salesperson went through all of the options and features.  This reinforced why I like to buy from a specialty store vs. online or department...it's the service you get!  I was able to order exactly what I wanted and I'd have to say that there is absolutely not way I'd be able do this on line and  it makes a big difference to see in person just what I would be getting.  In the process of our conversation I mentioned that I suffer from plantar fasciitis and it's a big part of why I love Birkenstock, for the support and comfort.  The salesperson lit up and mentioned that I have to try something...not that over the years, I've gone to local running stores and was offered several inserts that have been just OK.  And trust me, I've tried them all.  However, at Valley Sole I was introduced to BirkoSport inserts, which are very different...they essentially make any shoe feel like a Birkenstock.  Even if you don't suffer from any foot ailments, I'd try these, they are excellent and have several variations which would appear to meet any foot size/ shape etc.  I like these so much that I"m going to invest in several pairs and upgrade all of my shoes, dress, running, work boots, skates, etc.  Also, while I was at Valley Sole I was introduced to several very high quality brands and purchased 2 other pairs of casual shoes.  I'd recommend Valley Sole due to the quality products as well as the friendly and knowledgeable staff.

name: Gail Brown
text: Visited the store today and bought some of the wonderful SmartWool compression socks to wear on overseas flight to help prevent DVT.  Recently bought a pair of Naot shoes.  The employees were friendly and helpful.  Their inventory is always changing and they have trunk shoes from various reps from time to time.  I buy all my shoes from this store.  Have never had any problems with staff or products.  Would highly recommend store to friends, and frequently do!

name: Steve Mabb
text:
Just visited the Valley Birkenstock Sole store for a meet and great with customers and was very impressed with the staff and service provided.  The store looked great, was clean and tidy with a great range of stylish and comfortable brands.  Would recommend anyone looking for great shoes and sound advice to check it out - Holly, Julie and the team will take great care of you.  We are proud to have our brand represented in the store.

Steve Mabb
EVP
Orthaheel footwear

name: Sierra Landoll
text: Great friendly service 💗

name: Meredith Harrington
text: They didn't have a big enough choice of shoes.

resp.text: This is not a valid review. We are in touch with google to remove this false review.  It is written in response to a disgruntled ex employee soliciting friends to leave reviews.  Please ignore.

name: robin monroe
text: Great service and nice selection of shoes with great support. Thank you, Valley Sole !

name: Stacey McSweeney
text: I have a number of foot issues and I dreaded having to go in to buy orthotic shoes that would fit custom insoles, but I was pleasantly suprised by Valley Sole!  They have a great selection and can order so many additional shoes for you, as well.  The friendly and knowledgable sales associates helped me find shoes that fit my feet needs, as well as my sense of style.  While they have the styles you would expect, they have a nice selection of attractive, stylish shoes for a working professional.  Valley Sole is great about returns and even ordered another size for me when the original ones ordered ended up being too large.  I took one star off for price--these are pricer shoes and that can be hard to swallow.  But, the quality is much better and they are my go-to shoe store now, so it is worth the extra! I have been impressed thus far!

name: Martha Custer
text:
My husband has plantar fasciitis and I have been looking for a comfortable shoe for him.  I found Orthaheel on the internet and was trying to locate a store to buy them.  I phoned Valley Birkenstock and was told that they stocked them and they even checked sizes for me.  The next day we visited the store and were promptly greeted and offered assistance.  When I told the young lady what I was looking for, she remembered me calling the day before and even the size we were looking for.  She promptly brought out the shoes and talked with my husband about his plantar fasciitis problems. She brought out several other shoes, a compression sock and an ice pack- all to help with the plantar fasciitis.  My husband tried everything on and was so impressed with the feel of the Orthaheel that he wore them out of the store.

Julie was the young lady that was helping us and she was very knowledge about her products,and was very helpful with suggestions.  She was very kind & polite.  My husband is very pleased with all his purchases and says he will be going back soon to purchase more shoes (this coming from a man that hates to shop - especially for shoes) all because of the personal attention & helpfulness that he received.

This store really knows the definition of "Customer Service"!

name: Mandie Harrington
text: Amazing local business!

name: Sophia Muldrew
text:
I wish my first visit to Valley Birkenstock Sole on Airport Rd. in Huntsville, AL could be my last.
December 31, 2012 was my first visit to the store, it was about 4:30pm.
I made a purchase, the sales girl put the receipt in the shoe box.  On January 2, about 12:00pm, I went back with the unworn product, in the original box, receipt still in the box, to return the item.  (Note: A time lapse of less than 6 hours as they were closed on the 1st.)
I was told that I could not return it because it was sale merchandize.
The communication of that policy was extremely poor- it is not posted, the sale items are not marked, individually or as a group, and the sales people do not tell you verbally.
The only place that policy is communicated is on the sales receipt.  In addition, there are no prices on anything: sale or regular price items.

The store manager told the sales girl that she would take care of me, asked me to wait while she checked on something.  Returning to take care of me, she informed me that she had checked store records and since I was a regular customer I knew  about the "no return on sales merchandize" policy and therefore she could not help me.  (This should give you cause for concern, regular customers are given no preferential treatment.)
She offered for me to leave the item with her and said that if I did and walked out, she had no further obligation.
I continued to try to convince her that I was a new customer and had no idea about the policy.  I asked where it was posted, etc.  Her response was that in the state of Alabama it is "Buyer Beware".  I agreed that she could enforce that policy.

I asked if she typically opened the shoe box to read the receipt before she left stores so she could find "no return" policies, because that is the only way I could have discovered theirs. (I use the word 'discover' intentionally because this store seems to hide everything: prices, policies...)
I told her that reputation is important these days with internet data accessibility and that she left me with no alternative but to blog this occurrence.
Then she wrote me a receipt stating the amount I was owed I could spend in cash with that piece of paper and if I lost it there would be no effort of correction.

As if all of this, and the fact that I was now required to return, was not bad enough, when I turned to leave she told me that had I behaved differently she could have resolved this another way.  Basically, she did not like me (subjective) so she chose not to return my money.
THIS IS A HORRIBLE WAY TO RUN A BUSINESS!!  She just admitted to me that she could have given me what I asked for.  God forbid we do what the customer wants.
My thoughts are that their business model is failing.  The only reason to go in this store is to try on the shoes you want to purchase for a fit check and then go and purchase them at a discounted price on the internet.
The manager's justification from the other blogs--that it is a service oriented store is untrue.  The sales staff is so immature and inexperienced that they are a bother.  If you ask a price you are told, "oh it is about..."  About?  When I am shopping and spending these amounts of money, I want to know the exact price.
They seem to have lost sight of the personal aspect of the business and are overly concerned with money.  As an example, did they not think that the sales person (blogged earlier) could also be a customer?  Can they not relate that his experience, and mine, will be publicized for other people's benefit?
I have never been so poorly treated, ever.
What a shame I have to go back.

resp.text:
Dear Sophia,

Thanks for your feedback. Valley Birkenstock Sole is sorry to hear you are unhappy. We would like to help. Our policy for sale shoes is no return as these are priced for clearance.  Customers are told at the time of
purchase and it is stated on our receipts that SALE shoe purchases are final.
Normally we do not return sale shoes as is the policy, but it sounds like our manager accommodated you by giving you a store credit to purchase something else. When you return, if you will identify yourself to one of the owners, we will personally take care of you and make sure any questions or issues you have are addressed.
Valley Birkenstock Sole takes pride in well trained staff who offer full, sit down service.   I am sorry you did not have a pleasant experience in our store and we hope you will return to use your store credit very soon.

Best regards,
Julie Pierce and Holly McGinness, Owners

text: First time I went & my last, unless I can't avoid them.  The lady totally embarrassed me & was arrogant & RUDE!!?  Her shoes aren't worth that to me.

I am so terribly sorry for your bad experience. Please send me an email to info@valleysole.com or stop by the store so that we can talk about what happened. Our goal is always to love on our customers and I am so sorry that wasn't your experience.

Thanks,
Julie

text: Ok. The ladies who work at this location are the absolute best! They have always been extremely helpful when I need something for my wife. They also just helped me pull off a huge surprise for her birthday. I cannot say enough good things about them.

name: Lacey Graves
text: I arrived at this location at 6:02 in a Friday evening and their sign said they closed at 6pm. Not very good business hours for a Friday evening and how can they cater to the working woman? There was another customer inside and the doors we locked. I stood at the door and an associate finally came.  I explained I knew exactly what Iwas looking for.  A ring that was sold out online in my size.  I drove all the way from Decatur in hopes to find it.  I shared this and she said she couldn't let me in the store as they could only be open for so many hours. What does that even mean?  There was still a customer inside.  She closed the door on me and I was extremely disappointed. I am a long time customer of Brighton from Florida that just moved to the area.  I was happy to know there was a store close enough I could still spoil myself at.  I also work for a major retailer who does not close their doors till 15 minutes AFTER their posted hours.  Very poor customer service when retailers are struggling these days.  I will not revisit this location.  They have lost my future business.  I hope Brighton and the associates consider what customer service is to them, bending the rules just a little isn't bad for business.

text: The workers at the Charlotte Russe (CR), Tuscaloosa, AL, University Mall location have very bad attitudes and give very poor service. If they are that miserable working at CR, FIND ANOTHER CAREER. A customer service job is obviously NOT for you. Shelia, is one disgusting human being that needs prayer. I really hope corporate steps in because those workers are tarnishing the reputation of Charlotte Russe. I love CR, but I would advise any and everyone I know and don't know not to shop at that particular location. They are simply rude.

name: Niky Li
text: Horrible experience! The staff wouldn’t let me purchase shoes because they claimed I had already been there earlier that day. I usually NEVER set foot in Finish Line. I have 0 points on my rewards. They also claimed they had footage of me on their security cameras but couldn’t show proof of it. They lied about the shoes they had in stock. I was offered one size, but after some discussion in the back, the staff told me that size wasn’t available anymore and i couldn’t purchase anything because of my “previous visit that morning.” I can’t believe the staff lied and would not let a buying customer purchase from this store, just so they can keep the shoes for themselves!!

name: Chelsea Williams
text: Placed an order online to pick up in store. Received confirmation email but no other communications about pickup. Called customer service to cancel the order after 3 days of hearing nothing and they said I had to call the store. Called this store & they said my order had “already been processed out as if were picked up on accident .” I asked them to go ahead & cancel the order anyway since I clearly had not come to pick it up. They said they would have to see my ID in store to process the cancellation . I asked why no ID was needed to “process it out” to begin with & they said it was a mistake. I asked what happens if I don’t pick up the shoes, thinking they would have to automatically issue the refund, and these people said the shoes would just sit there since their system shows that I had paid & picked them up. They refused to cancel my order & insisted I had to show them my ID to get my money back. Customer service determined that  was A LIE!!! Had to call customer service back & get them to call this store just to get my money back. Terrible customer service. Never shopping here again.

name: Jacob Li
text: Horrible staff. My cousins and I went to buy some Jordan’s at the Finishline in Dothan, Alabama. They let me check out and they then went to get a size 11 for my cousin but then came back to tell us that another employee claimed that he already saw us here earlier this morning. Not only did they refuse show any proof (cameras) that we were here, they were rude and it didn’t seem like they cared. After that, I told my brother to come and get the size 11 for my cousin. They then said that every size had been raffled off and that only size 8 was available! I’m 100% sure that they planned on backdooring the pairs for themselves or to resell. Why would a shoe store manager refuse to sell shoes to customers and lie, claiming that we were here earlier but we all rode in the same car. This is most definitely the shopping worst experience I’ve ever had.

I asked her to repeat, and she said it with even more of an attitude than the first time. She told me what they didn’t accept I could pick up “over there” not giving any instruction on where that would be. My husband and I walked around the counter looking for my items and could not find them. We asked her, “where are they?” And she acted like she didn’t hear us. So we just left. I finished shopping and was fixing to ask her is there any way she could call her manager and ask, since I live in Florida and couldn't come back if she would take extra off, and before I could finish my sentence when I was at in there any way, she cut me off abruptly and said NO MAAM I CANNOT.  I was rather shocked. She clearly was rude, didn't listen and could care less. The manager is Kim and I plan to let her know. This was about 430pm.  If you want better customer service  and cheaper prices go to the one over by walmart at the north end. It's much better.

text: I wanted to sell some items before leaving town, so I took a basket full of clothes over on a Thursday afternoon at 4:30 PM and the girl behind the counter told me they weren’t buying clothes anymore that day because the (1?) person that buys had left already, so I had to leave my basket until I got back into town one Saturday. When I got to the store on Saturday around 5:45 PM two girls were behind the counter. I gave them my name and they pulled two items out of a black bin and I inquired about the whereabouts of my basket and the other clothes. The girl replied, “they’re over there,” and asked the other girl behind the counter to process my buy so she could go be on her phone. Once the buy was processed and I got my money, I waited a few minutes for one of them to get my items they didn’t buy. They didn’t, so I asked if I could have my basket. The girl who was on her phone said ambiguously, “they’re over there,” and pointed haphazardly towards a wall and went back to her phone. I found my items and left. This customer service is unacceptable and disappointing. I’ll be taking my business to Plato’s.

name: Keegan Williamson
text:
I can't believe all the negative reviews I'm seeing. Uptown is bar none, the best place in Dothan, or the tri-county area, to buy men's clothing. When I first moved to the area I immediately went to Plato's Closet to see what the Dothan branch had to offer, the short version is, not much. After going to Plato's several times in a 90 day time period and never finding anything of merit, a co-worker took me to Uptown Cheapskate one day before work. That's when it all made sense. The reason Plato's Closet was completely barren was because everybody went to Uptown, and I'm all for it because their price is easily half of what Plato's would charge and their selection is vastly superior.

I would also like to point out that the owner of Uptown has never been anything but extremely accommodating, courteous, and immensely helpful. If you don't like the value she gives you're clothing or accessories the solution is quite simple, shop elsewhere! As for me, when I'm able to not only buy two pairs of Bullhead pants(the clothing line has been discontinued since Pac-Sun went under and has become like finding a needle in a haystack) but also a beautiful yellow and blue Ralph Lauren cardigan, all for less than $30!? I know better than to look a gift horse in the mouth.

Truly leagues above their so called competition.

name: Maureen Schoch
text: I've been driving by this little shoe store for 5 years and never once stopped.  For some odd reason I thought it was mostly running shoes that they sold, but yesterday I discovered that is NOT the case.  I was with a friend who suggested we stop, and what a surprise!  They have a lot of wonderful casual shoes for men and women, and some great brands, like Yellow Box and Merrille, and most wonderful of all, they have good prices on them.  I loved their selection, and the women who worked there were helpful in the extreme.  I had them running back and forth bringing me different shoes in different sizes for an hour, and they were continually cheerful and never resentful.  Call me crazy, but in the end I bought 6 pairs of shoes, including sandals and wedgies -- and my friend bought 8 pairs!  This is not something we normally do; I've never bought more than 2 pairs of shoes at once in my life!  But I bought 6, and I'm not at all sorry, because they were so cute and such an incredible bargain (a half-price sandals sale was going on).  Check out this wonderful shoe store.  You may be as surprised and pleased as I was.

name: Chuck Missildine
text: Very clean establishment. I literally did not see one piece of paper or similar debris on the floor. Shelves were nicely organized with price tags, clearance racks and store personel easy to find. Everyone (employees and customers alike) was wearing their masks and following social distancing guidelines which made the whole experience even more pleasant since I was shopping with several friends including my one year old great niece and a lifelong friend who has an extremely compromised  immune system from struggles with Crohn's disease. Scored a ton of bargains on name brands and designer's fashions. Seriously, I got my great niece a pair of sneakers and a pair of adorable boots for only $2 each. By the way, they were made by none other than the legendary JUICY COUTURE. I would have had to shell out another $45-$65 if I had purchased these designer's labels from elsewhere.  I felt practically criminal after swiping a game carrying case plus a glass screen protector (two separate items) for my son's NINTENDO SWITCH. I paid $5 for both which saved me about $15 and earned me HUGE POINTS with my son. How about this bit of awesomeness: $3 for Beyonce Pulse perfume, 3.4 ounce bottle, normally $15 or more. I also grabbed 2 hoodies for $1 each. And whatever you do, do NOT get me started on the huge savings and discounts I racked up on for the rest of the clothing that I bought as an early birthday present to myself.

text: Service is hit or miss. I place a lot of online orders to pick up in store and typically have no issues. Recently tried to pick up two, one of which was in the back. I told the cashier I was picking up two online orders after a purchase. She looked it up, and instead of picking up my items from the cage of online orders in the front, calling someone to grab the one in the back, and having me step to the side for two minutes (as would be common sense), she told me I'd have to go pick them up at customer service, which already had a large line, because she didn't want to hold up the people in line. Thanks to her, I lost about 40 minutes of my life standing in K-Mart.

name: Shannon Hewitt
text: Selection may not be  as big as other stores but that doesn't matter.  They make up for it in customer service and prices. Great small town friendly feeling.  In the last few months I have purchased nursing shoes and  flip flops .  I went in tonight wanting a plain comfortable pair of work boots for our farm. They helped me find the perfect fit. The ladies boots were not fitting my plain Jane style and comfort needs . The ladies working helped me find a man's boot that felt like I have already broke them in. They measured  my 4  yo son's foot tonight and he got a new pair of tennis shoes. Buying him shoes was not in my plans but their prices were to great to pass up. I would have bought him a size 12 standard when he needed a 13 wide. My  son loved the fit so much he wanted to wear them out of the store. My husband was in the store for the first time tonight and he got a hat he was very impressed with the customer service. Keep up the great job ladies .I know we will see you again soon.

text: Great American owned business. Jennifer and Phil ( the owners) have the best attitudes you could ask for. From belts,buckles,boots,hats,shoes,clothes and Dusters, you can find what you want. And if you dont, they can get it for you. But know that when you go in, they are there to help you, but not try and force a sale on you. Make sure to tell Jennifer that her man in black sent you. ( and no I dont get paid lol) And Phil knows me as Bryan. Remember, buying American helps Americans. God Bless.

name: Wesley Kirkland
text:
We went today and we're drawn in by the 50% off sale. Turns out that sale was very limited and included just a few shoes, then they said they shipped off 90% od those to Tanger outlets. With that said I found a shoe I liked in my size and color on clearance. The rep brought them out and I decided to get them. They rang them up and it was $40 more for the same exact shoe that I just looked at. This really felt like a bait and switch tactic, the shoes looked identical and were confirmed that they were discounted. I was quite disappointed and we walked out.

On the plus side Amazon has the shoes promised to me for cheaper.

name: Gannon Slusser
text:
I went to Bridge Street to see a movie with my girlfriend at Monaco Pictures. We arrived a couple of hours before our showtime, so like anyone else would have done, we decided to take a look around and see what some of the stores had to offer.

I saw the Un Voyage Plain in the store window as we were walking by. I was in the market for a pair of comfortable shoes to wear to an upcoming event that requires all attendees to adhere to a business casual dress code. I don't often go to these types of events, so I didn't really know what I wanted, but I was immediately drawn to this shoe when I saw it in the store window.

I went in to take a closer look and was greeted by an associate named LeeAnn. She was extremely knowledgeable with a keen eye for detail. She asked me when I had had my feet measured last, and honestly I couldn't remember ever having my feet measured.

After taking my measurements, she recommended going with a half size higher than I usually buy and using insoles to take up some of the extra space since one of my feet is a half size bigger than the other. I took her advice, and I have never been more comfortable in a pair of formal shoes.

Overall the experience was great, and I will be a regular customer going forward. In fact, I received a coupon during this visit that I plan on using to purchase another pair of Voyages in black.

Hi Lois,

Thank you for your feedback. Our retail customer support team is working  really hard to make sure that every customer leaves with the best experience possible.
We would like to make it up to you if you can please reach us by email and reference case # 10168740. Our email is : RetailCustServSupport@Clarks.com . Let us know if you have any questions or concerns.

If you would like to speak to our customer service line who handles a wider array of issues, please call 1-800-211-5461 or email consumerservices@clarks.com .
Thank you for choosing Clarks.

With Best Regards,

Kevin

text: I will never go in Clark's shoe store again.  Be very careful about their "sales".  They advertise 50% off the second pair but that's only for shoes already on sale, which are poorly marked as being on sale.  In the whole store there may be a half dozen styles on sale.  This is too close to bait and switch for me to do business with them.

name: Wade Horton
text: Ive shopped here several times in the past with no problems. In the past few weeks I was looking to buy a replacement pair of loafers I love. They didn't have them in the store or online so I bought two pair that I thought would do online. Once I got them in I decided I needed the exact design I had and found them on another website. I decided to just take them back instead of using the free shipping label. The guy that was working was almost fairly rude and spent about 5 minutes inspecting the shoes (I received them the day before, I didn't even try them on). Then he proceeds to tell me that I need the email confirmation and the enclosed clarks receipt wasn't enough. I looked at him and stated that the piece of paper I gave him states thats all I need for a refund and I hope its not going to be a problem since the order number and barcode was on the shipping receipt. He then backs up and says "Oh, well do you know which card you used because this doesn't say!" I handed him my card and he finally finished it up. I know on slow days returns probably arent wanted, but don't make people feel they don't have enough to do a return.

text: Larger than the location I usually go in Destin.  Ample parking and everything was well stocked except for ammo.

name: Erika Moran
text: Cool place to visit. My 1st time at a Bass Pro Shop. Would recommend going at least once to check out the set up,the Bass and Alligator Gar tank&the gorgeous boats are a plus!! Lots of Country Instagram worthy props in there! Lol 😆😆😆 Also I thought most of the stuff was over priced in there. Just a little!

name: Mudd Mannipulater
text:
Smaller store than what I am use to. Staff was around but not overly helpful. The woman working the door was very helpful and a great example of how All the employees should act. The check out process was excellent. The staff on the 2nd floor were on their phones and they showed no motivation. The guy in the gun department was the same. He could not find the item I wanted. He didn't offer to order it in or to order it on-line. I was willing to do either.
The boat and ATV guy lost a sale  since they could not break free from their conversation to help me. I hate pushy sales people but at least acknowledge me after you see me taking pictures and returning to the same area 3 times.
I never saw anyone in the clothing departments so I didn't get the items that I wanted  to stock up on.
I return to Bass Pro because of the quality of the products and it is normally easy to get help. I did not find that at this store.
It was a surprise to find the outside water features seemed neglected too.  I  didn't see any fish and the fountains and falls that are normally seen were not there either.
Luckily I can find another store close by to get what I'm looking for.
I spent FAR less than I normally do at THIS Bass Pro store and I still need to do my spring shopping.
I will not return to this store if I can another one close by.

Please understand that this store is not exactly bad, it just doesn't have the warm welcoming flow and energy that I have grown fond to.

name: Anthony Moore
text: I went bass Pro shop in Daphne Al. Barely got in the door before someone started trying to sell me a vacation, you know where they send you somewhere and try to sell you something. I love seeing all the new stuff bass Pro shop has to offer , didn't appreciate that

text: We arrived 45 minutes prior to closing and needed camping supplies. A staff member at the door pointed us upstairs and we headed towards Camping. There were no staff upstairs and we couldn't find what we needed. I had to go downstairs and into the Fishing section to find an employee. He said everyone was doing inventory and not helping customers. He looked online, found the item I needed, and confirmed the were out of stock. He then referred me to Walmart if I need it quickly.

text: it's a great place to shop. for clothes as well Sporting Goods, cookout equipment as well as smoking equipment  always enjoy going there.

text: Our puppies had a great time exploring the store, huge selection.

name: Roy Forrest
text: This is without a doubt my favourite outdoor sporting goods store in all of Alabama Bass Pro Shops has everything I want it's like being a kid in a candy store with unlimited resources for money it is just an outstanding place I could actually spend the whole day in there and never feel like I got everything I wanted to get done finished And the associates in Bass Pro Shops are beyond reproach they are so helpful and so courteous and they are very easy to talk to and extremely knowledgable I truly cannot say enough good about this place.

name: George Cates
text: 58 years old in my day we would look at the sears cateloge and the first real gun we would get , fishing gear , bikes daydream for ever. Today I walked into the dream but it was real!!!! Great people quality merchandise. My first day in Bass Pro  Shop!!!! Going back next week. Take weeks to see it all.

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: Such a cool place...me and my kiddos had a great experience.  My son finally found his boots he'd been wanting and me and my daughter enjoyed the fish

Plus the associate where the guns are so acted like I was interrupting his conversation. I'm very disappointed. I'm not a local to this place I was passing through and it turned out to be a total waste of time.

text: They had good selection. Also a great place to go if you want to get COVID. They were NOT enforcing mask rule. To afraid of making an issue. I spoke to the manager, of course he did nothing.

text: Always enjoy going to bass pro restroom could use some cleaning more often

name: robert brukardt
text:
Clean and well organized.    Unfortunately they are short on ammo and reloading supplies like everyone else.

However the fishing section is stocked which is a plus.

name: Vance Blackburn
text:
This place is enormous!  We have visited one of their similar stores in Pennsylvania and were not disappointed.

Incredible detail to store layout and decorating makes this a place to see for yourself. A true place to bring the whole family for hours of enjoyment.

The kids will enjoy everything from the untold number of mounted animals to the shooting gallery. The usual point of sale goodies can be found at every register, but the real goodies are found in the old time store... The fudge is awesome!  Sit down meals and available at the in-store restaurant offering a variety of animal meats.

I was impressed with the knowledge the staff had in their respective departments. The gun area had well trained staff and offered many hints on the model I was interested in.  My wife hit the women's clothing like a fire sale and found some great outfits.

This store is very accessable to those people with disabilities. The elevators are great for those of us with bad knees.

This place gets a big five star rating.

name: Kim Low
text: Clean. Friendly. Packed out but after this past year I was happy to see all the faces (all employees had masks on but all the customers didn't since the mayor(?) ((The news)) canceling face masks in our area yesterday) walking around and shopping.

name: Brent
text: Always Awesome!!  Very  Knowledgeable people

name: Mike Brown
text:
I shopped online for sale items and placed order. All went well with online purchases and received email a few minutes later that my order was in progress and I would receive a email when all the order was ready for pickup. All this was at 6:00 am. I thought all was good and I wasn't going to have to stand in line at the store because I'm not in physical condition for that and do most of my shopping online. Thirteen hours later I received a email from Bass Pro that my order was canceled due to items now was not available and wouldn't be offered at that price again after that sale date.
The online service is not your friend and is not a good way to shop deals at Bass Pro..☹
There's other stores that have excellent online service !

name: Jim Divers
text:
How can I cancel this order? Ordered on the 17th of December and still no info on when it will ship.
Thank you for choosing Basspro.com. Below is a complete transcript of your conversation with our Outfitter.

Chat By Chat (Sharla W.) (01/01/2021 07:12 PM)
[07:05:52 PM]You are now connected with Sharla W..
[07:06:09 PM]Jim Divers: How can I cancel my order
[07:06:22 PM]Sharla W.: Good evening Jim
[07:06:38 PM]Sharla W.:
It will be my pleasure to assist.  One moment please.

[07:06:45 PM]Jim Divers: W127276569
[07:06:54 PM]Sharla W.: Thank you
[07:08:36 PM]Sharla W.: I apologize your order should ship next week.  As it is in the shipping process, I cannot cancel the order.
[07:09:18 PM]Jim Divers: So if it does not ship next week how do I cancel?
[07:11:25 PM]Sharla W.: Unfortunately, due to the high demand, our warehouses have gotten behind.  We are not able to cancel order when they are in the shipping process.  If your order does not ship by Wednesday, please contact us and we will check to see if the item is no longer available or can be canceled.
[07:11:46 PM]Jim Divers: Thanks
[07:11:57 PM]'Jim Divers' disconnected ('Concluded by End-user').

name: Shawn Dean
text: Drove an hour to come buy a bow on sale. I arrive at the archery section and it takes 30 minutes for an associate to arrive at the desk. I tell the associate of the bow I want, and after 20 minutes they find the bow. I'm about to finally purchase the bow, and they tell me that I need to come back tomorrow morning at 9am because that is when another more skilled associate will be in who can set up the bow for me. I tell them that I have to work and that I just drove an hour and they tell me to come another time and call ahead. Why have someone work in the archery section if they are unable to set up a compound bow?

name: Rachael Ralph
text:
We've come out here in the past to shop and visit with Santa and have had a good time. This year was absolutely dismal. It started out bad in the messy bathrooms. The floors were covered in trash. Only one of the paper towel dispensers were working, and barely at that, only if you pulled it out in a certain way. It took 3 strangers and myself to find the working dispenser and get paper towels out of it, it was a team effort.
There were far less people in the store than previous years, so I'm not sure what their excuse would be. Most of the children's attractions were broken or half working as well. The kids were practically bored to tears. We only stayed for pictures with Santa. Our wait was 2 hours. And by all means it should have been half that time. There really weren't many people in the store. Crafts that were supposed to start at noon didn't begin till around 12:30 and the craft person was stale and thoroughly uninterested in their job. Before when we had come there was quite a bit of interaction and Mrs. Clause even came over to help.
It was a total waste of time coming out here. Their restaurant isn't even open anymore. So much for being a kids event. I didn't even make our purchases, and we obviously had lunch elsewhere. I can buy this stuff elsewhere too lol.

name: Michael Thomas
text:
Mr Jim Hagale / CEO Johnny Morris

I purchased a boat through your company (Spanish Fort) and wanted to directly share my TERRIBLE experience with you.

13 Jul 20:  Purchased the Regency R230LE3 Sport for $67,759

After the staff inspection and detail of the boat, it was delivered to my home on 13 Jul.

After delivery I called sales rep to inform him that: Boat Cover not included, Ski Pole missing, cushion springs to get into the departments not working, missing console cover piece, crack in fiberglass of console, latch for shower bracket broken, trickle charger outlet not secured to boat. (Items needing replacement when purchased: Co Captain Chair had tear, 2 seat cushions had tears, sun shade cover needed replacement, radio (2 control panels) need replacement).

14 Jul 20:  Put boat in the water, trim gauge did not work..... AND BOAT STARTED TO SINK ON RIGHT SIDE!

Got boat out of the water, called sales rep and I took the boat back to Spanish Ft on 15 July.

Determined, leak in right side pontoon. Was informed I must go through the warranty process to get it fixed.  I have played this game now for 8 days.  NO CHANGE TO THE BOAT!  STILL WAITING FOR WARRANTY OFFICE TO CONTACT DEALERSHIP!

I told them to replace the boat or take the boat back.

I have been told by your Finance Dept to call dealership.

I have been told by your Corp Customer Service Rep to call dealership.

Dealership says:  That's not how it works, you will not get a replacement and we will not cancel the loan.

So, here we are.  Me emailing the CEO to get help!

The boat has not even been titled or funded yet.  This experience and your company customer service is absolutely unacceptable.  Bass Pro Shop sells a retired military man a boat that starts to sink in the first 30 mins of ever touching the water, confirmed by staff it has a leak and was told.... we will file a warranty claim.  Sorry about your Luck!

Can't wait to share this experience with my community, with your community!

Mike Thomas

name: Ronald Clement
text: Extremely disappointed at the customer service I received at this store location. I tried to purchase a flannel/hoodie combo shirt, that was marked on one of the middle store isle racks, for $17.99 as advertised on the sign above the rack ( at 0910 AM). They were marked down from $44.99. I went and did about 15 more minutes of shopping and went to check out (at 0925 AM). At check out the item showed up as $44.99 and I said I would take it over to refund for them to research the price further. The associate at the refund desk stated the price was never $17.99 and there was no sign there showing it was ever that price. My wife walked back there and could you imaging the signs mysteriously vanished from the time I picked up the item at the rack to the time I went to check out. I was made to look like a liar and a cheat by the refund associate and Bass Pro. The only thing they had to say was they had mistakenly left the sales signs up from the weekend and I would have been okay with that. Instead I had to listen to the other refund associate say I was in the right and the signs were removed late but she could not make the other associate listen to her. Funny how they want to thank you for your military service one minute and then make you out to be a liar in front of other customers the next. I will no longer be shopping at the Bass Pro Spanish Fort location and I would suggest that all customers take photos of sales prices on the racks for they are to be susceptible removed at a moments notice to prove the customer is wrong and vendor is in the right.

Other than that, very nice store, but you'll lose great customers to white trash just there for a free picture!

text: I bought a gun on line to ship to the store.when I arrived at the store a greeter was at the front,  ask where to pickup my online gun .I was told service desk in front, stood in line , service person said no you have to go to gun department. I arrived at gun counter no one around ,found a guy putting up stock showed my paper work .he acted like never saw an on line order.he brought out paper work I filled out , once approved,  I ask about red dot scopes. I was told find a better deal on line , didn't ask if I needed ammo ect .no one in the store was friendly,  acting as if mad they had to work.i won't be back over priced any way .I had no one ask me if I needed an help in the store .I was wearing ppe so what's up bass pro .I have a 5000.00 dollar limit credit card , I'd close it for not lowering my credit score. Teach your people some customer service,  or you might be joining  j.c. penny .

text: Bass pro shops is kinda like a theme park for outdoorsman, but with less rides. I mainly go there for shooting supplies and firearm related stuff, which they have in abundance. Most of what they don't have they can order. Prices are about in line with other stores, and selection is better than average. They stock lots of reloading supplies and tools, holsters, mags, and ammo by the literal ton.

name: Ordanumn
text: I turned in a compound bow about six weeks ago to get it restrung. I was told it would take about 3-4 weeks to order parts and repair the bow. After around five weeks I called to check on my bow and they said they would call me back. I recieved no call back so I called again and was put on hold, then was hung up on. I went to the store to check on it in person and after waiting 30 minutes I was informed that they haven't even ordered the parts yet. I am taking my business elsewhere,  sadly I will not  shop here again.

text: The store was very large and very well stocked and very clean. Of course, it must make it a lot easier to keep it that way when nobody buys anything. This is a store for the well heeled. 50 dollar shirts and 17 dollar ball caps are not for everyone. Their wide ranging stock and impressive choices are a spectacle, and the store itself is a must see, but don't plan a trip there AND Disneyland in the same year if you work for an hourly wage. Probably awesome for the pro's with sponsors, but I'll have to stick to Goodwill.

name: Curtis Jackson
text:
I've had bad experiences my last 2 visits
I needed a new dehydrator so I went to bass pro, I knew what I wanted and where it was so I got there just about 20 minutes till closing. I zipped up to the section I wanted and saw what I wanted, well it was more than I could lift so I looked around for someone to help me. Not finding anyone I changed my mind and went with 2 smaller units as I'm standing there figuring the difference in price a sales lady showed up to tell me the store was closing that I needed to leave. I told her ok but she could put the 2 units back on the shelf. She changed her mind  so I took the 2 smaller units and left. Definitely not what I was expecting
Today I went to get some black Friday sales on electronics for ,y pontoon and I took2 hunting knives to get sharpened. I get there and I run upstairs to drop them off while I shopped. I asked if I could get my knives sharpened and the kid told me they were to busy selling guns that I would need to leave the knives and come back tomorrow. Well they lost around 2000 dollars in sales in electronics today because if that's the attitude of bass pro I'll shop elsewhere

name: Doran White
text: Love this place i just wish I didn't have to drive all the way to Alabama or destin to visit the closest one to me

name: joseph carson
text: Always a friendly place and excellent customer service throughout especially in the fly fishing section.

name: Michael Troxel
text: Love this place

name: LAND HARRINGTON
text: Wide selection, seem to be more specialized toward outdoor stuff on the gulf coast. Examples, fishing, salt and fresh water.

name: Rushing Waters
text: The workers are always friendly and they're good for finding specialty items.

name: Kelsey Rummel
text: You can bring your dogs inside

name: Kerry AnnaBelle
text: We like taking a trip to Bass Pro shops for a quick family drive.  We used to go to the restaurant before it was closed but still a nice getaway.

name: Benjamin Harms
text: I'm not a sports lover or fisherman by any stretch of the imagination. But, I found this store to be really incredible!  The layout was a little overwhelming and felt sprawling. The line to see Santa was unbelievably long, so we took a pass on that. According to my sister, the best time to go for a picture with Santa is on a weeknight, rather than on a Sunday afternoon. Haha The stairway that trails up beside the fish tank was in and of itself a fun attraction. The elevators were even nicely themed to compliment everything. I was really impressed with the entire ecosystem that they have designed. The prices were higher than I would ever want to pay for simple gift ideas, but this just isn't a simple gift kind of place. The gift shop had some yummy options from party mix to crazy flavors of mixed nuts and cotton candy, and even Bacon Hot Chocolate (but even at only $1.49 per pack, I was still afraid to buy and try it). We also ate at the restaurant, which I wrote a review for separately. Great experiences to be had here!

name: Robert Watson
text: Employees are nice, helpful and friendly.

name: Johnny Collins
text: Great selection. Good people that are willing to help.

name: Marivel Preciado
text: 1st time at Bass Pro Shop & it was a welcoming experience. David of the fishing dept was very helpful. He really took the time out to answer all my questions from fishing gear to local fishing spots, as I was visiting from Texas. His awesome customer service definitely must be recognized!!

name: L T
text: High prices, pretty good fudge.

name: Ginny Phillips Allen
text: Massive inventory, kid friendly. Friendly personnel greeted, but no one ever offered to help. Live fish in aquarium under waterfall and catfish in "creek" were impressive! I've never seen an albino catfish before. It was huge!

name: Patricia CARBONE
text: poor quality

name: Thomas Ausborn
text: Bass Pro Shops of Spanish Fort is a veritable treasure trove of goodies for casual and seasoned outdoorsmen alike. The store is vast and features a pleasing atmosphere. The inventory is diverse and well stocked. The employees are helpful and knowledgeable. Pricing is reasonable for most products though sometimes quite high for specialty goods. A visit to the store is sure to be a positive experience even if you don't plan on making any purchases. It can be kind of just a fun place to peruse.

name: Phyllis Wallace
text: This is always a fun place to go.  I love taking the kids here.  There is a lot for them to do.  The restaurant is pretty good too.

name: Rene Thibodeaux
text: Always a great place to visit if you are an outdoor enthusiast

name: Mikeaul Martin
text: Friendly helpful personnel, very clean.

name: Daphne Chalker
text: Great sales reps! Definitely very helpful at the gun counter!

name: Jerome Lowery
text: Had problem with one of their products which they replaced without a hitch. Good business.

name: R. Brown
text: All you need to go outside and do stuff

name: Gayle Mora
text: Really cool and interesting to browse and shop. Good food and friendly service. Lots of fun!

name: Michael White
text: I found the good rain suit that I've been wanting. It was On clearance for a great price. I used my Club Card dollars that I had saved up to make it even better.

name: C P
text: My first time coming here was amazing. They have "feeding time" for the fish on fridays.

name: Daniel Burke
text: This is any sportsman's heaven on Earth. Great selection, and they price match, so great prices too! They also have the best customer service of any sports store I've ever been to.

name: Jack Webster
text: If you fish, hunt, camp or want to gift for someone who does, this is the place.  Great destination for guns & ammo too.

name: David Clark Sr
text:
Unbelievable.  This pretty much sums it up.
If this place doesn't have what you are looking for.  You probably don't need it.
Very nice employees and clean .
Very large and well laid out in sections. You could spend a complete day  in this store.
From fish hooks to complete boat rigs,  it's in this building
Price is ok and mostly competitive.
I was very impressed  and you will be too.
There are fish aquariums and very nice restaurants.
5 stars.

name: Emily Hubble
text: It was my first time visiting a salt water bass pro. I felt like a kid in a candy shop!

name: SheriMarie Zurenko
text: There was a piece of wood by the indoor water supply I tripped over. The female employee I told rolled her eyes at me. With the prices being so high on many items you would think that employee would not of rolled her eyes at me and been a little more concerned with the safety of shoppers.

name: Stephen Miller
text: Pretty much the same Bass Pro experience as any store. Can be a bit daunting seeing the size when one walks in, but the folks working there are so helpful and will direct one where one wants to go.

I only let that effect my post because employees witnessed this and even let them proceed to jump everyone in line, silently, just to get rid of them. I wasn't raised to reward bad behavior! Other than that, very nice store, but you'll lose great customers to white trash just there for a free picture!

text: Went in the Spanish Fort location to buy me and my wife a pair of Costa's, and the lady looming around us just made us feel very uneasy. No better way to run off customers than to make them feel like you think they are thieves. I work all over the country and this is my "local" Basspro and can't do business with anyone who makes us feel like they we are thieves. No other basspro does this! Not to mention we both had Costa's on our head!!! Very disappointing.

name: Shawn Andrews
text: First time visiting this Bass Pro.  It was awesome as any other Bass Pro.  The place had everything.  It was clean and well organized.  The staff was friendly and attentive, but not pushy.  I'll definitely be going back!

text: Always a great store what ever state it is. The guy in the boat sales was great friendly man. Thanks Bass Pro Shop!

text: Fun place to shop. They have a great selection. Food is good. The aquarium is nice

name: Megan Bolton
text: Wish they had better sales. I also wish that they sold more for plus size women. Not all women who like to fish, hunt, etc are considered average and shouldn't have to resort to wearing mens clothes for comfort

name: Chad Warnol
text: Great atmosphere with a good selection on outdoor items. Typical for most Bass Pro Shops.

name: Tiffany Bodie
text: Every year I bring my family to bass pro shop to take pictures with santa do some Christmas shopping. I love bass pro shop all together but today we had a horrible experience. We had to digitally sign up to take pictures with santa and we got there at 11:30 the wait was 2.5 hrs so after shopping going out to eat we came back at 2 exactly 2.5 hrs to find out there was another 50 minutes to wait okay no big deal we do more shopping with three kids finally we get the message at 3:30 that its time to take pictures with Santa to only find out their system is down and it'll be another two hours of waiting and all the people who weren't able to sign up to take pictures will be completely turned away as the bass pro shop employee stated. My kids were crushed when we told them we had to leave because I had to go to work in an hour and they spent all day being patient waiting to see santa. I'm one family out of a whole store full that went through this I hope they come up with a better system by next year but honestly I dont think we will be coming back to see santa it's much easier and less of a hassle to just go to the mall.

Do not trust the website when I says they have something in stock I drove over an hour to be there when they opened to get something I needed that said they had in stock at this store and it was out of stock!!! To the staffs credit they where very nice and tried their best to find it and the computer said it was in stock for them too

text: The store was absolutely beautiful I love the aquariums. Not sure if I'm going to contact corporate about it or not other than that and the exorbitantly high prices it is an absolutely beautiful store.

The Spanish Fort BPS has a good selection of both freshwater and saltwater fishing gear and tackle.  This store typically has quite a few Mako boats on hand as well as many pontoon boats.  The store sits close to Mobile bay and I-10

There are a few department stores in the same shopping center, but not much else.

Don't bother sending me anymore emails or flyers I will not be back. I was loyal but field and stream is closer and they always have what I go there for. Also your company just deletes my rewards points. I am done.

name: Jamilah Haseeb
text: We visited Bass Pro shop on 8.1.18, which was our anniversary. I am only giving a 2 star rating because the man at the entrance was polite and Deandra at the Outdoor Traveler booth was excellent. We received no customer service anywhere else in the store. We went up stairs to the guns because I was interested in buying one. There were 2 associates there speaking to one customer at the counter. As we proceeded to the counter to look at the selection we were never acknowledged by them. Not even a simple greeting, even though we browsed near the counter and the camping section for several minutes. We then decided to go down stairs. We passed 2 more associates and was never acknowledged. We went to the general store. There was only one associate there and she had a line (This was the only place in the whole store that had a line of customers). We browsed  there hoping the line would soon shorten but no additional help came so we left... Just poor customer service for a business that was not that busy. Very disappointed.

name: Charlie Weaver II
text: My 6 year old son was Awestruck by all of the "nature" exhibits / decoration. He and I also really enjoyed the fish aquarium.

name: Ronnie Cupit
text: This place is awesome!! I have been to several Bass Pro Shops across the U.S. and this one is another job well done by Bass Pro Shop. The decor matches all the other stores, but the people were so nice and helpful. I enjoyed my shopping experience and was very pleased. Thanks Bass Pro Shops!!!

name: Dawn Sherman

name: Thomas Creighton

name: Keri Crosby
text: We always have to stop at one if we are close. I love coming to Bass Pro even if I don't purchase anything. The restaurant they have in there is delicious too. Perfect for a quick lunch or supper.

name: J P
text: The workers at Bass Pro are always friendly and provide a positive atmosphere so it's always a great place to shop they basically have everything u need for outdoor sports or just outdoor pleasure.

name: Sharon Condon
text: The Biggest fish store and story for outdoor enthusiasts in Spanish Fort.

name: Jodie Plato
text: My 11 year old grandson needed a new pair of camo water boots. Got a great brand at a great price. He wears them all the time. He would wear them to school if they would let him. My grandson always enjoys walking around and looking at everything that is displayed at Bass Pro Shop. It is one of his favorite places to go.

name: Micheline Scarcliff
text: Great people

name: John Marshall
text: More fun than six flags.

name: Riley Wallace
text: Crazy cool aquarium, pelletgun game taxidermy of ever animals

name: Stephen Hoist
text: I have been going to the Spanish Fort location for several years.  It had been a while since I was last in there.  I have never had an issue before but this time I was there to spend some money.  I went up to look at a  rifle scope that I had been looking at online.  I went upstairs and took the long way to get there.  We were greeted properly walking in so didn't see any reason to think anything else.  We walked through the bows, then walked past the rifle racks to the scopes.  The guys working the counter were working with other customers so I looked around, I found the one I wanted to see.  In that process, I found another that I was interested in I looked up to see the status of the salespeople and they were over on the other side talking to each other and what looked to be looking at a phone behind the counter.  I left the counter went to check on kids who were by the aquarium.  We walked around and I decided I was going to get both of the scopes I found.  I went back and both salespeople were talking to one person.  So while I was waiting, I found a third scope I wanted.  The lady they were talking to left and they went back to the other end of the counter and did what they were doing before.  Now I don't like when a salesperson hovers over me, but I have worked in retail enough to at least let a customer know I am there to help.  I couldn't even get that out of them, so we walked away.  They missed a out a $4K sale.  I am not going to beg for them to help me.  They weren't busy.  The way I see it is they were just busy ignoring me.  Walking to the exit, I found a gear bag for a decent price and decided to buy it.  The man at the cash register was awesome.  If the guys at the gun counter were, Bass Pro would have sold me a lot more than a $12.99 bag.  I will go back again.  Like I said, this was the first time I had a bad experience there.

name: STEPHEN KEARNEY
text: You have to visit this store...they have everything.  Very knowledgeable staff

name: Jimmy Wayne
text: Brought in a 13 Concept A3 baitcaster which is a 200 dollar and up reel. I have taken many of reels to this location and have never had an issue at all with any of them untillll today. I was explaining to the associate that this reel has a special coating and I would get it spooked somewhere else if he thought their machine would scratch it and this special coating is to guard it against saltwater. I confidently walked around and did some more shopping picked up my reel and checked out and went on about my work day. On my way home I peeked In the box to find the top of my new expensive reel scratched up and the coating removed. I have no confidence in this store was told that they would handle the situation and call me back later and low and behold here we are with a scratched up reel I do not want to fish with due to it might corroding and the warranty is void. I’ll update if they make it right but lost all confidence in their pro service.

text: Nice store but I only shop here when I have gift cards to spend as they are more expensive than anyone else or if I'm researching something I want online and know they carry it I'll go look at it in person there before I order offline for cheaper. I've ate at the restaurant a few times had good and bad experiences there, kids love the fish tank of course and they always have a really good santa and bunny. I'm going here today with my 4 year old because i have a bunch of gift cards saved up and can get him some cool toys. I'm sure they have some specialty stuff that's hard to come by at other places and the staff always seems helpful unless it's a mad house day in which case I just wait my turn someone will help you when they can.

name: Jenn Daughenbaugh
text: My husband went to the Bass Pro Shop in Daphne, Al. today, looking to purchase a small boat or kayak for fishing. He went into the tracker boat section, spoke with two elderly gentlemen, he doesnt rememeber his name but the gentleman that let him back in the building after looking at the boats outside didnt say anything to him, just opened the door and walked away. So he approached another gentleman sitting at the desk, asked about one of the boats they had outside and about financing, the gentleman’s response was if you dont have a 700 or better they wont finance you and they wont finance anything under $5000.00. Assuming because of how my husband looked that his score was under a 700. So my husband went inside and started looking at kayaks, he was up there for close to an hour and was not approached one time by a sales associate to see if he needed help, at that point he left the store. So not only did you lose a possible sale on a boat you also lost out on the sale of a kayak. Your salesman in the tracker boat section are extremely rude and all your employees need some educating on customer service and he will never shop in another Bass Pro Shop again.

But to be told once we got there really upset me. I’m not sure if it’s just this bass pro that doesn’t allow pics with animals or what but for the last 3 years I’ve taken pics with santa and my dogs. text: Vista the store 7/8/2017 I was looking for kitchen towels with a bear theam and knew this was the place to find them. Find them I did on the bottom shelf in the fudge room. The stack was coverd with mouse droppings, mouse hair and left nut casings. REALLY 3 employees in there not helping customers clearly they should be checking their goods. Gross. Continued to shop ready to check out and only 2 lanes open on a Saturday with a packed store. The place was full of employees but none seemed to be doing much more than standing around. After 15 min in line and not moving much at all we left our full cart and walked away.  On the way out the employee at the exit asked how we enjoyed our BP experience I let her know about the mouse mess and wait to checkout her response was "owell that's BP guess you won't be back" drove an hour and half and won't do that again.

name: Jacqueline Walton
text: I rated one star simply because i spent $70. The manager was very rude and inconsiderate when talking to customers and other employees. One employee was at the front near the entrance and the manager was all the way at the register yelling and having a out loud conversation about scheduling and her interview at another job while us 10 customers were shopping. The manager then started walking around the store spraying some kind of spray in the air (too much spray) as if we wasn't there. Do that after you clear the store before letting the next only 10 at a time customers in. My daughter was holding some jewelry we wanted to buy.. The manager said "Mam you're supposed to leave all jewelry at the front of the store, I'll take it" she gave it to her then while walking towards the register, she hollered across the store loud at another employee "Are you watching the jewelry? I know you're not because jewelry is on the floor" meaning a customer was holding jewelry prior to purchasing. I WILL NEVER SHOP AT THIS STORE EVER AGAIN!!

name: Jennifer Pouncy
text: Love, love, love this store! The wide selection of clothes and shoes are fantastic! Whatever your style they are sure to have it. Great deals on some of the cutest outfits I've seen this year! I found 2 dresses on the $3.99 rack that I bought after I took them both to the counter for a price check because I was sure they had been misplaced. I really thought that they cost more than the ticket said because of how cute and stylish both the dresses were. Definitely my favorite clothing store! I'll be sure to come back asap.

Not one associate on any computer or that picked up a phone could give me an answer. Go figure with big corporate stores. Went back to individually owned, had me one there while I was still shopping. Yep, a little out of the way, but, I'm going back to the little guys, where it all started anyway.
