text: I love Academy Sports so every chance I get when I am traveling, I stop by one.  This one was the least exciting one I have been to.  The shoe selection was lacking for women’s running shoes.  It just seemed such a lackluster store.  The first time I have walked out of an Academy Sports store without spending a penny.

name: CALG RN
text: Bought my water sport gears here. Various brands are sold here, so you have alot of options. Me and my husband also buys ammos here. They have a decent amount of stocks but preferrably go in the morning 'til 12pm, just to make sure you still get some. Only 2 boxes of ammos are allowed per person. Bit pricey, but where else can you find it but here, service is good too. Friendly personnels are working there. We'll keep coming back for sure. Would like to avail the academy member card (but it's a credit card) and don't wanna manage another one.. so yeah.. but if you can, I would encourage you get it and enjoy alot of discounts.

name: Emily Gayle
text: Extremely helpful staff and a pleasant store to go in. I was just not satisfied in the bicycle section for the lack of prices and sizes there. Online they are very organized but the building does not allow for cell service so I could not pull up my wishlist to see what bike matched. Instead I had to crouch down and twirl tires to see what size they were and try to find the size I want. You cannot get a bike in a box which is tricky for storage and wrapping when you want to save the bike for a present. But good that it is assembled by a professional.

name: Edwina Riddlespriger
text: Horrible! Waited in line at the site to store desk while cash only customers were checked out only to be asked if I had checked in to receive my purchase once it was my turn.😡 This is definitely not the process and the cashier seemed to be confused. I then chose to go to my car to utilize the curbside option. While waiting yet again, I called inside of the store to speak with a manager. Once someone finally answered, I asked for the manager and could hear the employee hand someone the telephone. I assumed that I was about to speak with a manager, only to be placed on hold without anyone saying anything to me. I did eventually receive my purchase and the young lady that bought it to me was very nice.

name: Christy Reeder
text: Went in to buy a weight bench. Asked the man up front to get someone to help us.  He got on his headset and told someone we needed help, we stood there for at least 15 min in sight of him and no one showed up and he didn't bother to call again.  Finally my husband and I picked up the box alone, weighed close to 90 pounds, and carried it to the register passing at least 2 employees on the way who didn't bother to offer to help or get us a cart.  Kinesha at the register greeted us and we tried to explain to her why we had a bad experience but she didn't say another word to us the whole time we were paying except to tell us that they don't offer a military discount (in Montgomery, Alabama miles from an Air Force base).  Called and spoke to Megan the manager and she was nice but we still won't be back.

Then the shoes they get all kind of colors that don't ever go with anything that they sell on the rack.  Then they sell Nike tops with no bottoms?  All the Nike stuff they only got either black or gray ... man I'm not Michael Jordan ... really?

Told a manager and no more lines opened to check people out. I wonder how much money y'all lose and people just walking out with $500 to $1,000 worth of cash in hand. text: Was told my the store that they would open at 5 pm last week and when we arrived at the store, the manager was outside turning MULTIPLE people away because they were not opening until the next morning. We had drove over an hour to get there to get a trampoline. The manager, Angela, was very hateful and RUDE.  The assistant manager, Ashlee, was beyond nice though! She did everything in her power to try and help us get the trampoline that we needed, that we had been told multiple times that was available in the store but was a small stock, so we were trying to make sure we got it. Ashlee even went as far as to try and get it available on the website for us so we could reserve it there. Overall, we got dragged around in a circle by this store, and it seemed to be because of a lack of communication between management and employees.

text: Their staff is amazing.  While they are definitely overworked, they remain smiling & helpful despite the overwhelming stress of not being properly staffed to serve all customer traffic.  I witnessed one customer berate an employee because the checkout line was too long of a wait. Yes - it was long, but it's not the fault of the employee, she was working as quickly as she could despite the occasional random customer walked up & interrupted her with some  question, meanwhile she's trying to continue checking out the many patiently-waiting customers in inline. Let's all remember the employees deserve our appreciation & patience during busy shopping times...and they don't make more money during those times, just more stress while the corporate folks take in the sales profits. Just try to treat everyone with the same respect you would like to receive from them.  And Academy employees deserve raises & more hired staff to create a sales team force!!!

name: John Pritchett
text: I am heading to do hurricane relief work in Big Pine Key and am gathering supplies to take with the group of us going down there. I needed to purchase some steel stakes to secure palm trees that are damaged from the storm. I went to the Montgomery Academy Sports Store and purchased these stakes. I talked with the salesman in the back and notified him of our mission and asked him if they could give us some kind of discount and was told no. I asked him to ask the manager and he did and the manager said no. When checking out of the store the manager was up front chit chatting with an employee and a customer ( doing nothing) and I again asked him face to face if he could help us out and he again said no. All the other companies have been good about discounting supplies. Lowe's of Wetumpka,  Marvins in Millbrook,  Harbour Freight,  Home Depot all have been helpful especially Lowe's in Wetumpka. After being told no face to face I told him I appreciated it and then proceeded to name the other companies that have responded responsibly. I have bought alot of product from academy over the years but this experience has left a bad test in my mouth with the company and particularly with this manager. 🚷

name: Adam Foutz
text:
I hate leaving bad reviews, but this store deserves it. I needed a new suit for a wedding, and went in to order my suit well in advance. A pair of pants had to be ordered, no big deal. After 3 weeks of not hearing anything from them, I called and was told "we'll call you back." No call back. So, I called again a few days later and spoke to the store manager. I was then told "I'll call you back before lunch." Guess what? No call back. I was up against a deadline, and gave them well over a month to get a PAIR OF PANTS in and get an entire suit tailored.

After calling numerous times, I physically went up to the store and got my money refunded. The manger was there and knew who I was, and offered to get it tailored same day. Too late, I ended up having to rent a suit for my event. I highly suggest going elsewhere to find a suit in Montgomery, this store is incompetent. Spend the extra money elsewhere.

text: I have not been to Academy since last spring because of poor service. I just went online ordered a pair of shoes stated I could pick up at the store within the hour. I received a call from the store that they didn’t have my item and that it would be best if I canceled my order. That my money hadn’t been taken out of my account. I tried to cancel online but it kept freezing up. I called the corporate customer service waited on hold for over 30 minutes and then they cut my call off. I then called the Decatur store back and ask for a manager. The girl that answered said “ I’m a manager” she was short and rude with me . Said they would cancel my order and I would get a email or text when it was taken care of. I did receive it and it stated my money would not be back in my bank account until 7 business days. So isn’t that great!! Academy ruins a Christmas present for my daughter. And has not a second thought or concern for me . I tried to do the right thing order from home social distance for everyone’s safety and this is the thanks I get. I paid for an item last spring $ 700 and basically the same thing happened only difference is they didn’t have my purchased item so I had to buy a $100 higher item of the same kind. I guess you make so much money that I make no difference. So I am sure I won’t be missed. But very poor service and no compassion for taking someone’s money at Christmas.. Merry Christmas Academy Sports Decatur!!

name: Jordan Morgan
text: Bought work shoes for my husband and they ended up being too small, so he went to return them the next day August 7 and it is now August 20 and still no return. I've talked to managers and customer service reps and basically have been told this store is very lacking on communication and when my husband talked to one of the managers in the store, since no one would answer the phone, they fed us a lie that it was out of their hands when truly they are the only ones who can clear the matter according to the many customer service reps I've spoke with. We are now on two weeks and still waiting for over a $100 purchase return. They could have sold the shoes in this time. They basically stole from us and we are at their mercy. My suggestion is don't do any business with these people. The carelessness I've experienced has been the biggest headache and for something that is truly so simple as a debit in-store return.

text: I just had the worst experience of my life shopping at this store. Not once did any salesperson try to help me (too busy trying on clothes). I was corralling a 2 year old while I had arms full of clothes to try on (no one offered to start a fitting room for me) as I return to work in a week and need a new wardrobe. I needed different sized but not once did someone come check on me and offer though I was in there for 30 min. When I left the fitting room with my arms full again, no one asked how it went, nothing, and there was one other person in the store.  I asked about a military discount as I saw an advertisement for a student/teacher discount. I was told no. I just spent $400 and am tempted to go return it all because I’m so disgusted with the service I received. The manager needs to do some firing and rehiring, and I only hope the manager wasn’t there while I was shopping.

name: Wriston Helms
text:
Not open to posted hours. Went 3 times, not open.
Update. They come back at my review with a snarky protest and suggest I can't read their sign or tell time.. Nice..
I assure you I can do both well.

The take-home message here is to check their Facebook page to see if they are following their own hours before you drive to the store.
Got it?

resp.text: Our hours are clearly posted on our facebook pg and on our front door of biz as being Tuesday through Saturday 10am to 5pm. If we ever have to close early, we make a sign on the door and post to social media. If we can't get up there we post to social media only. It's a shame that people have to leave vague negative reviews when we rarely close during our regular posted biz hours. If this person would've contacted us after "missing" us the first time we would have done what ever needed to be done to assist this potential customer but odds are they came on a day we are closed (always closed Sunday and monday) or they came after 5pm. It's that simple. I have documented time sheets that prove when our biz is open and many, many days we rarely close right at 5pm to accomodote shoppers in the store!

text: I spent over 10 minutes in this store browsing today, and on my last trip to the store, and I was completely ignored by the staff.  I didn't purchase anything on either trip.  Today I went to the counter to purchase a top.  When asked by the clerk if I had found everything I needed, I told her no.  I told her that no one had spoken to me, nor offered to help me.  She didn't say ANYTHING!!!  No apology, nothing!!!  When I attempted to buy the top, I was told that I couldn't use my rewards card due to a policy change.  I then stated that I wouldn't be buying the item.  Again, no reaction from staff, nor the manager.  They DON'T DESERVE YOUR BUSINESS, FOLKS!!!
